programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwicks in London, Nathan John Finch and Debs Franklin are doing deals on a pair of original fish paintings and an original theatre organ with a £35,000 asking price.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In south east London, Nathan and Debbs are taken aback by a ventriloquist's dummy, while in Sheffield, Dan appraises a classic campervan and considers one of his biggest ever deals.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who were expecting babies when they first met him. In 2009, Rik and Helen Francis wanted to change their city-centre living in Manchester for a move to a family home in Hale and Altrincham. In 2004, Alison and Phil Clarke were hoping to move from Bolton to Herefordshire to be nearer their relatives.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer helps art director Ben and screenwriter Lucy find a home in south London on a budget of £295,000, while fellow first-time buyers Cat and Ed in west London receive assistance from Kirstie Allsopp in tracking down their perfect property in an expensive area.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Retired engineer Barry and his Maltese-born partner Pauline search for a property in Suffolk, on a budget of £425,000. Presented by David Bull and Kirsty Duffy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week comes from the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich, Kent, with hosts Jan and Les Fisher convinced their traditional place will impress the others.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Jen Edwards throws the first in a series of parties in Swansea, but despite claiming to be a confident cook, she fumbles with her choice of starter. After overcoming trouble in the kitchen, the first course goes down well, and the host decides to get her guests to work up an appetite for dessert with a Zumba dance workout.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher James Knight hosts a school-themed party in Swansea, complete with children's games and bangers and mash. As well as entertaining his guests, James will have to keep tensions between Karen and Jen to a minimum if he is to stand a chance of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby player Keith Larrard hosts as the competition in Swansea reaches the midway point. He hopes to impress his guests with a Jackson 5 theme and a naked butler, but his guests are confused by a cryptic menu with dishes including Shoulder Sheep Sh'Moan.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Karen Wood hosts the fourth dinner party challenge in Swansea and hopes to impress not only with her buffet-style menu, but also by providing a hot tub. However, the diners' mixed expectations about her cooking skills, together with a series of mishaps during the day, mean the outcome is far from certain.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Katherine Waldemar Brown hosts the final party of the competition in Swansea, and asks her guests to adhere to a tarts-and-vicars dress code. She hopes her sophisticated menu will impress her fellow diners, but the evening is threatened by their unruly behaviour. The winner of the £1,000 prize is then announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt are joined by guest presenter Kiran Jethwa to investigate the latest dietary trends and scientific advances in the world of weight loss. In Los Angeles, Kate looks into reports that caffeine could be a powerful weapon in the battle of the bulge, while Jimmy heads to Belgium on the trail of chocolate that is packed with bacteria that are supposed to keep people healthy.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The East Midlands is the focus of this week's house-hunting, as Kirstie Allsopp joins Sam and Becky, who have a £100,000 budget and are looking for a house in Nottingham with a sizeable plot of land. Phil Spencer is with Nigel and Jane, who sold their home in Australia and moved back to the UK when Nigel was diagnosed with early onset dementia. But despite being back for months, they have struggled to find a property that lives up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Premiere. Biopic of the Kray brothers, exploring their rise to power in the London underworld and conflicts with rival gangs from the point of view of Reggie's wife Frances, who remains devoted to her husband even as he remains equally bound to his brutal, unstable sibling. Starring Tom Hardy as both twins, with Emily Browning, Christopher Eccleston and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan: The Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Midwife Sarah and partner Stephen look forward to the arrival of their twins at Liverpool Women's Hospital. Cameras also follow young couple Holly and Nick, who surprised her mum Michelle by announcing their planned pregnancy. Meanwhile, Tasha and Jonny come in to have their second child after a traumatic birth with their first baby, Nevaeh.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio are in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: In a bid to get the friends to focus on the new game, Leon takes them away for a trip on his new luxury yacht, where Ewan falls for the chef and Josh discovers his host has paid someone to compile a dossier on Abi. The vessel ends up run aground, but Watto finds inspiration via an encounter with a Chinese fisherman. Comedy drama, starring Nick Helm and Jim Howick.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Tracks with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The historian explores the UK's network of ancient trackways and roads, which have been walked by pilgrims, hunters and invaders over the course of the past 5,000 years, each one shrouded in myth, mystery and legend. In the first episode, Tony delves into the stories, songs and sacred places along the Icknield Way in Norfolk and Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and Ellie Beardmore look at a dazzling diamond-encrusted mobile phone, a rare German clock, a stunning diamond cluster ring and a solid silver Rococo-style bowl. At Nikolas Patrick in London, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick Devine consider deals on Harry Potter's broomstick and an impressive collection of Manchester United memorabilia.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick Pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick inspect a collection of boxing memorabilia owned by former boxing promoter Kellie Maloney, as well as an unusual electric unicycle. At London Road in Sheffield, Dan has a diamond encrusted bracelet in his sights, and is also considering deals on two high-end leather belts and a huge collection of coins featuring some of the world's most dangerous creatures.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Surrey, where Susie and Andy Clark's house is set to be demolished. However, the couple are still looking for a new home after 18 months of searching. Meanwhile, first-time buyers Sam Summers and Jess Jeary have a firm idea of what they want, but need help turning their dreams into a reality.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer visits the town of Bradford-on-Avon in Wiltshire, where Ghika and Ronnie Coyle have been searching for the perfect property for 10 years. Also in the South West, Kirstie Allsopp helps cautious first-time buyers Mark and Ellie Devine look for a home in Bristol.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help Louisa and Julian, who want to move from their one-bedroom house in Middlesex to a more spacious home in south Devon on a budget of £260,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, where owner Sarah Summers is dreading the arrival of Robert after their confrontation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events manager Peter Ferguson hosts the first party in Edinburgh, but his guests are less than impressed with his pricey chateaubriand main course. After a gospel choir provides the evening's entertainment, one guest finds herself in trouble, leaving another diner speechless.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alison Lynch hosts the dinner party in Edinburgh, and attempts to win her guests over with a ju-jitsu-themed evening. Rena Martin appears to be endearing herself to the group, and Cynthia Gentle impresses Gary Reid by telling him what she can do with a mango.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Cynthia Gentle hopes to win over her guests with a theme of 1950s glamour and an international menu, featuring a main course that includes crocodile, as she hosts the third dinner party in Edinburgh. Security firm boss Gary Reid decides to provoke a debate on fidelity, while tensions erupt between ju-jitsu teacher Alison Lynch and events manager Peter Ferguson.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health worker Rena Martin opts for a decadent menu as she hosts the fourth dinner party in Edinburgh, but the rowdy atmosphere proves too much for one of the guests, who ends up asking for a taxi home.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Security manager Gary Reid hosts the final dinner party in Edinburgh, and installs cameras in his dining room to ensure he caters for his guests' needs. Alison Lynch and Peter Ferguson continue to argue, but tensions are forgotten over a cracker-eating game, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the conclusion of Gordon Ramsay's visit to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, he confronts sisters Rita and Lisa with an ultimatum, and finds himself stuck in a war between the waiters, chefs and owners over who is to blame for the Italian restaurant's failings.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, where he meets a stubborn owner who doesn't react well to criticism. Tom bought the restaurant for his daughter Andrea, but six years later he's still refusing to let her run it. Can the chef break Tom's iron grip on the business and persuade him to change his outdated approach?.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke returns to Harrogate, North Yorkshire, to check on the progress of Carol and Majid Nadry, who after 25 years living in a bungalow, embarked on an ambitious midlife adventure - buying a water tower to turn into a five-storey home. After huge delays and eye-watering legal costs, the couple have finally built the two-storey extension that was the key to creating a family home with character. George sees how the industrial heritage of this unique building is beautifully complemented by a 21st-century glass and sheet-metal extension that finally realises the old water tower's hidden potential.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt are joined by guest presenter Kiran Jethwa to investigate the latest dietary trends and scientific advances in the world of weight loss. In Los Angeles, Kate looks into reports that caffeine could be a powerful weapon in the battle of the bulge, while Jimmy heads to Belgium on the trail of chocolate that is packed with bacteria that are supposed to keep people healthy.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Professional singer Precious seeks romance with amateur magician Earle. The restaurant also welcomes company director John, who hopes fellow Scot Greig is the man he can settle down with. And fellow diner Hebe is on the verge of giving up on finding Mr Right. Hopefully she will connect with fine wine merchant Charles.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Ladies' man Luke, 30, is ready to give up playing the field and is searching for the one. His date is 29-year-old PR manager Sophie. Tired of turning up to weddings alone, she's looking for a man to become her 'plus-one' in life. The restaurant also welcomes Bristolian mother of three Mandy, whose date is 52-year-old landscape gardener Andrew.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fallen by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri.(n)

programme.title: Shannon Matthews: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The disappearance of Shannon Matthews was a story that gripped and then appalled Britain. Nine years on, this documentary examines her kidnapping and why people close to the case believe the police should reopen their investigation. Featuring the insight of some of those closest to the case, the programme charts the impact on an innocent girl caught in the lies and greed of those who were supposed to be caring for her.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: The heartbreaking story of young couple Sophie and Robert, who were the victims of a vicious attack because they dressed like Goths.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: Baby-Faced Mums

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: The observational documentary series exploring the lives of British ex-pats in Benidorm continues, as businesswoman Vikki decides to tempt her UK-based clients into embracing the Spanish lifestyle more vigorously with a `Spanish Day' at her salon. Meanwhile, a bad break-up for 21-year-old Ben, who runs the resort's only British-owned mobility scooter business, prompts his dad Mick to fly in to provide some much-needed perspective. Plus, the show provides an insight into the world of twin sisters Catherine and Patricia, expert scrimpers who keep meticulous records of their expenditure, once managing to drop their weekly outlay to just one euro.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary about living on benefits meets people struggling to survive island life. They include Tina, who is struggling to cope on the Isle of Sheppey in Kent - despite turning her life around and kicking her heroin habit, she is now finding life on the island tough thanks to her mobility problems. Single parent Matt lives in Cowes on the Isle of Wight, where the lack of jobs makes life a constant struggle, while Chrissy on Canvey Island in Essex is refusing to pay her rent as she believes her home is not up to scratch. As a result, however, she is facing eviction.(n)

programme.title: Baby Ballroom
programme.desc: The young dancers try on dresses, have their make-up done and choose new dancing shoes ahead of a prestigious competition in Essex, which is particularly important for Andrei, whose father Ovi has travelled all the way from Romania for the event.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy Kids: Our Secret World
programme.desc: The first in a three-part documentary series exploring childhood in Gypsy and traveller communities, beginning with an introduction to 12-year-old Oliver, who has already learned to drive, but believes his true vocation in life lies with horses. Also featured are 13-year-old aspiring model Sylvanna, who must decide whether to take a lucrative contract or preserve her identity, and eight-year-old Margaret, who might jeopardise a sparkling academic career should she choose to follow her sister's example and leave school at the age of 11.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Timmy's new business ends up threatening taxi services in the Colorado town, sparking a Wacky Races-type contest between competing transportation choices.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The boys film Craig's mother undressing and upload it to the internet. But as the clip becomes a viral sensation, they feel guilty.(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Drama about a bitter, racist old man who begrudgingly realises his need for redemption. A disgruntled Korean War veteran, Walt Kowalski is openly prejudiced, and doesn't hold back when a family of Hmong people move into his increasingly multicultural neighbourhood. However, when the family's teens come under threat from gangs and bullies, Walt cannot help but intervene. Begrudgingly he forms a bond with them when they try to steal his prized possession, a 1972 Gran Torino car(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house. Comedy(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: New York widow Holly is devastated by her husband's sudden demise, but messages he left behind offer a ray of hope(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: The Man Without a Face
programme.desc: Compelling drama about a former teacher who has been a recluse since being disfigured in an accident. He is befriended by a lonely 12-year-old boy, who seeks the teacher's help in qualifying for the military academy attended by his late father(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: William Peter Blatty's Oscar-winning adaptation of his bestseller about a child possessed by a demon(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Office worker Wesley Gibson is frustrated with his boring life, dead end job and unfaithful girlfriend. Everything changes when a sexy and dangerous woman named Fox walks into his life to tell Wesley that his father was an assassin. Fox soon initiates Wesley into an ancient band of killers called the Fraternity, led by the mysterious Sloan. The former weakling is transformed into a skilled assassin by his new associates, but is his new life really as it seems?(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust. Action(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him in the middle of the Pacific. An elemental drama of hope and survival(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen travelling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A disgraced basketball coach takes a job at a small Indiana high-school and leads the small squad on an improbable run for a state chamionship. Meanwhile, he helps the town drunk, a former basketball player, redeeem himself(n)

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: A former FBI agent takes under his wing a young boy with autism whose parents were murdered. He soon discovers that the boy has deciphered a top secret government code and now his life is threatened by a ruthless official(n)

programme.title: Starring Adam West
programme.desc: Actor Adam West is profiled(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin scores as a hip secret agent in this hilarious spoof of blaxploitation flicks, directed by Malcolm D. Lee. Griffin's character works for a black spy organization that's battling "The Man" and his efforts to suppress black culture. Denise Richards costars as White She-Devil. Chris Kattan, Dave Chappelle(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: The Office star Rainn Wilson portrays a drummer named "Fish," who gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars. Fish has spent the past two decades languishing at soul-crushing day jobs while his old bandmates became legends, continuing to grace magazine covers and dominate the radio. He might just get another chance at musical success, however, when his teenage cousin invites him to drum for his high school garage band, and they end up catching the ear of record executives. Now, Fish is determined to live the hedonistic rock & roll lifestyle he missed out on 20 years ago, but his new bandmates don't appreciate his hard partying -- and neither do his middle-aged knees. This Fox Atomic comedy co-stars Christina Applegate. Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum) and Tom McNulty co-produced the feature, which was penned by Wallace Wolodarsky and Maya Forbes, and directed by Peter Cattaneo (Opal Dream)(n)

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: Meek physics professor Larry Gopnic finds his life unravelling as he deals with his cheating wife, his layabout brother, his disobedient children, threats to his tenure and a next-door neighbour who likes to sunbathe in the nude(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: NaÏve Texan Joe Buck drifts to New York and, with the help of local wheeler-dealer Enrico 'Ratso' Rizzo, tries to make a living as a gigolo(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Conservative Welton Academy is enlivened by the arrival of a charismatic English teacher who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two ageing friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on holiday together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Director: Bryan Bertino. A young couple staying in an isolated vacation home are terrorised by three unknown assailants(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent goes undercover and infiltrates a group of extreme athletes in order to prove they are using their specialised skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. The film is inspired by the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Documentary-makers filming the antics of a rock band follow the team when one of the musicians is found murdered in his trailer. Javier shows off, Beckett is camera shy, while Castle is left to direct matters. Later, an affectionate moment caught on camera causes some embarrassment. Nathan Fillion stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the discovery of four bodies in a jeweller's shop. Suspicion soon falls on the husband of one of the victims, who is revealed to have changed his identity to escape a shady past. The shop's security tapes are subsequently discovered in his flat, but the defendant surprises everyone by insisting on representing himself in court - and makes a big impression on the jury.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Animal rights activists are implicated in the death of an Aids researcher killed by a bite from an infected monkey, and use the ensuing court case to drum up support for their cause. As events unfold, McCoy and Carmichael find themselves debating ethics with lawyers who argue the protection of animal life is a valid defence in a murder case.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinister and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam goes undercover as a bomb specialist when he investigates the death of a demolition expert, killed while driving the car of a notorious club owner. However, he faces a race against time to find explosives located across LA. Meanwhile, Callen learns more about his past and Hunter decides to reshuffle her team.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Castle and Beckett investigate a case with many potential suspects after the founder of an adult-movie franchise is found dead, having been strangled with a bra. Meanwhile, a furious Castle discovers case details are being made public via Alexis' video blog.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Danger closes in when the epic battle to bring the criminal organisation HR to justice reaches new heights, as Reese and Carter drag a wounded Alonzo Quinn away from the gunfight and head for the federal building to turn him over to the FBI. Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a Hispanic man found dead from a severe chest trauma after being involved in a staged car accident with two other illegal immigrants - and soon find evidence linking similar incidents with the same employer, chiropractor and insurance adjuster. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a student who proves to be the estranged son of a powerful real-estate tycoon. The finger of blame points to a mystery woman seen with the victim outside the college, and when tracked down, she claims to be his sister. However, Briscoe is not convinced, and suspects an extortion scheme.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Angell and Danny's search for the murderer of a security guard puts them on the trail of a master thief (guest star Nelly Furtado), who targets high-end department stores. Meanwhile, Mac, Sheldon and Flack investigate the death of a college student who wrote for his institution's newspaper, and learn the victim may have uncovered secrets that some people on campus would kill to keep protected.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a dishonourably discharged marine is accused of beating a Japanese tourist to death, having already been linked with the rape of a businessman's daughter. He claims that he is in love with the girl he is alleged to have raped, and that the accusations being thrown in his direction are a fabrication initiated by her father.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a naval seaman and an infamous arms dealer are found dead near the Mexican border. Evidence suggests the men were trying to smuggle a wooden box into the US, but there is no sign of the container, nor any clue as to what could be inside. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis think they have stumbled on the work of a serial killer after a woman is found on the cusp of death, having survived days of torture. Briscoe and Curtis are quickly on the case and are shocked to discover a plot involving the victim's own family.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Novak enlists Clark's help to gather evidence against a judge whose unacceptable bias in two child-abuse cases resulted in the death of a youngster and the wrongful imprisonment of an innocent woman. Police drama, starring Diane Neal, Marlo Thomas, Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A school headmistress is caught on camera sexually assaulting a teenage boy, but her behaviour later proves to have been caused by an operable brain tumour, prompting Novak and the team to allow a plea bargain. Unfortunately, the case turns out to have unforeseen complications. Starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The crew tackles a huge fire at a boarding school that leaves a deep impression on Severide, Dawson takes her exam and Boden's grand plans go awry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A marine recruiter is found dead on a civilian shooting range - but there is no blood at the crime scene and evidence suggests he died elsewhere. Horatio uncovers evidence suggesting the killing could be linked to the death of a soldier during combat in Iraq, prompting a second homicide investigation to be launched. Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Terror suspect Sonya Barak goes on the run from assassins sent by her own side, forcing Horatio and the team to race against time to recapture her and bring her to justice. Meanwhile, the presence of a cameraman recording the work of the lab causes Wolfe to make a mistake and compromise vital evidence. Starring David Caruso and Jonathan Togo.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Alarm bells ring for Dawson when Pete asks her to meet his mother, and more drama awaits when her police detective brother Antonio needs a fake alibi. Meanwhile, Clarice's due date arrives, bringing with it the biggest test in her relationship with Shay, and Severide comes face to face with an old foe.(n)

Suspicion falls on the business partner of the victim's husband and a witness comes forward to identify him, making everything seem clear cut - but not for long.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A restaurant owner is beaten to death and Briscoe and Green's investigation leads them to a gang of thrill-seeking teenagers who tried to steal from the victim but ended up killing him. The ensuing case leaves McCoy with a dilemma over whether the accused are old enough to face the death penalty.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Hawkes is accused of killing someone in a bar-room brawl, and seemingly irrefutable evidence is produced against him. Mac and the team are taken off the case, but refuse to accept he is guilty and ponder whether anyone has a motive to frame him. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinister and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a reporter is murdered as she prepares to break a story about a mysterious Libyan freedom fighter named El-Libi. The activist is wanted by the country's government after establishing `radio free Libya' in the aftermath of Gaddafi's closure of the internet. Meanwhile, more details of Callen's past begin to emerge.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett feels she finally has an opportunity to incriminate senator William H Bracken, the politician who had her mother killed, after the charred remains of one of his employees - and possible mistress - is found inside a dustbin. Stana Katic stars.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: A badly-wounded Reese goes on the hunt for Simmons, seeking vengeance for what he did to Carter, leaving Finch desperately trying to locate his friend before he succumbs to his injures. Crime drama, starring Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson.(n)

The case takes a more complicated turn when an eyewitness is found dead and the detectives discover Lonegan has a twin brother.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the attempted murder of a tough judge, but when the culprit is found Carmichael and McCoy have a difficult time building a case. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Sam Waterston and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella fears she may have been infected with HIV-positive blood while conducting inquiries at a murder scene, and Danny investigates the case of a woman whose body has been found in a bath filled with water and rose petals, but has trouble establishing the cause of death. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam heads to Sudan to help a CIA agent gather evidence of al-Qaeda terrorist training, but Callen is forced to rush to the country too, when one of them is killed while carrying out the mission. Crime drama, starring LL Cool J and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks places his job in danger when he shoots and kills an unarmed man during a mission to retrieve Semtex explosives from a marine warehouse, prompting unexpected emotions for Kensi as she contemplates losing her partner. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: FBI agent Dana Lewis suspects that a 25-year-old rape-murder case in New York is connected to several unsolved crimes across the country and joins the SVU to investigate. Lewis relentlessly pursues her prime suspect, but Benson and Amaro have their doubts about his guilt. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.desc: A woman is arrested after the attempted kidnapping a six-year-old girl, and tells officers the child is her daughter. programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Boobs in Arms. World War II was just heating up, but the U.S. hadn't yet entered the fighting when the Three Stooges made this comic short. It opens with the boys selling greeting cards on the street, none too successfully. One surly guy in particular is a victim of the Stooges' harassment. To get away from his wrath, the boys dash into an apartment building, where they find a weepy young woman who thinks her husband doesn't love her anymore. To help her out, the Stooges offer to try to make her husband jealous. The woman's spouse turns out to be the very same man they harassed a few minutes earlier. To get away from him -- again -- the guys get in what they think is a bread line, but it's really a recruitment line for the Army. In a flash the Stooges are in uniform -- only to discover that their sergeant is the very same angry husband. They manage to make it through basic training and are sleeping through bomb blasts when they're woken up and sent on a mission. The sergeant has been captured and they're supposed to bomb enemy headquarters with laughing gas. Naturally, the gas shell explodes on them and they're captured. At the enemy headquarters, they manage to knock everyone unconscious while laughing uncontrollably. The place is being shelled by the American troops, and the Stooges, still laughing, ride one of the shells as it soars out of the building(n)

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October
programme.desc: John McTiernan's thriller stars Alec Baldwin as CIA officer Jack Ryan who finds himself caught in a tense, volatile standoff between the US and renegade Russian submarine commander Marko Ramius. Ramius is in charge of Red October, a submarine way ahead of all America's technology and strike-force. But on its maiden voyage, Ramius sets sail for American waters. Is he just testing the sub, planning to unleash a nuclear strike, or setting out to defect? Both the Americans and the Russians plan to destroy Red October but Ryan believes Ramius is defecting. Can he save the captain and his craft from both sides?(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: Christine, a 70-year-old retired cleaner comes in for an operation on her finger, and six-year-old Olivia is admitted to Leeds Children's Hospital to have a biopsy on her bowel.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin assess a Victorian flat in Brixton, London, a former pub in Crumlin, Caerphilly and a flat in Telford, Shropshire.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team explore the truth behind supermarket deals and offers, and also report on the so called 'healthy' snacks sold as an alternative to sweets at supermarket tills.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A retired policeman comes to the aid of a young man after his car careers off a ferry and sinks in the harbour, and a pilot evacuates his plane after a huge engine explosion.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two married couples take up the challenge in Brampton, Cumbria, as they battle to find three items to make a profit at auction, with help from experts Anita Manning and David Harper. Tim Wonnacott hosts.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mrs Tembe is on a mission to discover the secrets of Ruhma's heart, hoping to get Heston the answer that he longs for, and Daniel struggles with his new reputation.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple search for a rural home in West Yorkshire with a budget of £500,000, which must have enough space to fit a beloved model railway.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Culinary challenge hosted by Sheree Murphy in which michelin starred chef Rupert Rowley puts three home cooks through a series of challenges, including how to make a crepe suzette.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Kate Bliss takes on John Cameron at a car-boot sale in south London, where their aim is to buy and sell antiques and make as much profit as possible. Along the way, John meets a former England footballer and Kate tries her luck playing cricket.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker hosts the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Rielly family lower their food bills, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. The pair have a challenge on their hands as each member of the busy family have very different eating habits, meaning mum Stacy cooks 3 different dinners every night, including meals for her son Harry, who has Type 1 diabetes.(n)

programme.title: The Met: Policing London
programme.desc: Police deal with the stabbing of a young man in Hackney over a Bank Holiday weekend, but as he is taken to hospital another emergency call comes in, and a second stabbing has also taken place less than a mile away. Meanwhile, detectives from The Metropolitan Police's Sexual Offences Unit try to gather evidence against a man suspected of sexually assaulting a woman with Down's Syndrome, and police in South East London deal with staff in newsagents and supermarkets who have been targeted by masked gunmen.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with David Mitchell, Judy Murray and Anita Rani competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including sniffing, walking and sugar lumps.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with Laverne, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: A 64-year-old grandfather is rushed into Barnsley Hospital's A&E with a severe pain in his abdomen, and a local teenage footballer is brought in with a dislocated elbow.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters explore a Victorian semi-detached house in Dresden, Stoke-on-Trent, a two-bedroom semi in Croydon in Surrey and public toilets in Kincardine, Fife.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team unravels some of the costs involved in eating out, and ask whether restaurants charge a fair price for wine. Plus, the ins and outs of tipping.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: An amateur race driver loses control on the track and his car somersaults towards the crash barriers, his safety cage fails and he is left hanging upside down from the vehicle. Plus, a young mother contacts emergency services suspecting her baby has meningitis.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Kate Bliss help two sets of friends searching for items at the Lincolnshire Antiques and Home Show. Charlie Ross presents and tries his hand as a wartime firefighter.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie investigates a patient's suspicions that her husband is cheating on her, but the truth is far stranger. Rob is weighed down by guilt, and Ruhma and Heston make secret plans.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a nomadic couple find their 16th home, searching near the Devon coast on a budget of £500,000. Away from the hunt, the presenter visits an eco-friendly brewery.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Theo Randall puts three amateur cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make linguine asparagus carbonara, choosing one of them to join him in the final.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Kate Bliss v John Cameron UK Antiques Fair.
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and John Cameron search for bargains at an antiques fair in Berkshire. Kate struggles to make her first purchase, while John hunts for weird and wacky goods, before they attempt to sell the items they've bought for a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Gabby Logan present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Steven helps Abi plan her 21st birthday party, she realises all might not be well between him and Lauren. Dot steps in to help Honey assure Will he has nothing to worry about in his new flat, and one resident is faced with a heartbreaking situation.(n)

programme.title: Kat and Alfie: Redwater
programme.desc: With Agnes pushing for the Moons to leave town, Alfie agrees that Tommy needs to get back to school - while secretly worrying about his own health. Has the time finally come to share his concerns with Kat? Eileen reveals her plans to transform the family farm into a cookery school, and while Roisin is appalled at the idea, Agnes is delighted her daughter has found a reason to stay. When Kieran is forced to face his fear of water, past memories come flooding back. Shane Richie, Jessie Wallace, Angeline Ball, Maria Doyle Kennedy and Fionnula Flanagan star.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: The Isle of Sheppey.
programme.desc: New series. Nick Knowles travels to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent to meet two extraordinary dads, Garry and Kyle, who have adopted four vulnerable children - three of whom have special needs - to give them the best life possible. But their cramped three-bedroom bungalow is making family life difficult. So to give this family the space they so desperately need, the DIY SOS builders are undertaking their most ambitious project yet - to demolish the bungalow and build a bespoke five-bedroom house in its place. But with just nine days to complete the task, it looks like being their toughest one yet.(n)

programme.title: Election 2017
programme.desc: David Dimbleby takes the helm for the BBC's comprehensive overnight coverage as the results of the snap General Election are announced. Over the next 24 hours the people of Britain will discover who will lead them over the next five years. BBC correspondents led by Andrew Marr, Nick Robinson, Kirsty Wark and Sophie Raworth will be at the key counts, while Jeremy Vine, Emily Maitlis and Professor John Curtice analyse the results as they come in. Mishal Husain interviews key political players, media editor Amol Rajan follows how the night is unfolding on social media and political editor Laura Kuenssberg assesses the impact this result will have in the days, weeks and years ahead.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: Two British policemen are on the hunt for drug dealers in Perth and a leading Flying Doctor subjects her new British recruits to an intensive training course.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville examine why some meals have fallen short of expectations, and reveal the truth about pie filling quantities.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Culinary expert Frances Atkins tests three home cooks who are tasked with making a German pasta called spaetzle. Sheree Murphy hosts.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: William Mager finds out what the main political parties are offering deaf and hard of hearing voters, and representatives from the main political parties answer viewer's questions.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: The latest political developments interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Journalist Jonathan Fryer meets his sister for the first time since he was adopted at 18 months of age, and they solve a long-standing mystery surrounding their mother.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Adrijan gets caught in a lie, angering distracted Superintendent McKay who covertly seeks to prevent a reformed youth being dragged back to crime.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how certain British ingredients make traditional combinations, preparing a pork and apple dish and a pear and Stilton tart. They also find out how Yorkshire pudding was made in the 1700s, and discover it was not originally served with beef.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: A baby elephant needs to be flown to Nairobi if it is to survive, while the herd's matriarch has developed a strong bond with the youngest orphan. Jonathan Scott investigates the disastrous impact of poaching, going on patrol with a team from the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust. Presented by Michaela Strachan.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.sub-title: Autumn and Winter - Against All Odds.
programme.desc: Ewan McGregor narrates as summer gives way to autumn and winter in the Highlands. From October to February, extreme weather is expected to batter the Cairngorm plateau. For the region's wildlife, these brutal, dark seasons trigger a game of endurance for which they must carefully prepare. Throughout the autumn, Scotland's reindeer bulls fight for dominance in ruts that can last for hours, and hurricane-strength winds lash a seal colony on Copinsay, where vulnerable pups must stay close to their mother if they are to have a chance of surviving. As winter arrives, the Highlands are blanketed in snow and ice, and while the frigid landscape retains its beauty, the moment of truth arrives for mountain hares, ptarmigan and golden eagles.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: James Braxton and Helen Hall set off on a trip from Bristol, heading to Corsham and travelling through Bradford on Avon in Wiltshire in their search for treasures before ending up at an auction in Swindon, where they hope to sell their purchases for a profit.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Companion show to the main programme, as Chris Packham is joined by the broadcaster Sara Cox, dung expert Richard Jones, and Paralympic swimmer Ellie Simmonds.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. In Zermatt, Michael learns how intrepid early 20th century British mountaineers turns Alpinism into a fashionable sport, and at Martingny, Michael puts his faith in a St Bernard after he is buried in the snow.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales, returning chef Phil Carmichael and newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie, go all out to impress with their main courses. Each chef uses Welsh lamb as the centrepiece of their dish, showcasing a range of techniques and using an array of unusual ingredients to elevate their main courses to banquet level.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan catch up on all the wildlife action that has taken place over in the last 24 hours. Plus, a report by Martin Hughes-Games from Scotland as he goes on the trail of an animal architect, and Lucy Cooke presents another film demonstrating how a simple object can connect people to the natural world.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC Filmmaker Natalie Hewit spent three months in Antarctica following the work of the everyday heroes who have been challenged to move a vital polar research station, Halley VI. Built on the Brunt Ice Shelf, it sits far beyond the Antarctic shoreline, but a crevasse in the surrounding ice threatens to send the station adrift.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: When Vincent receives a visit from a tax inspector, pursuing him for unpaid tax, he decides that now would be a good time to get out of the showroom and spend some more time with his family. They take a trip to Southend, but it does not go exactly as they planned. Meanwhile, Fitzpatrick and Lavender clash over the ethics of Page 3 when a competition in The Sun newspaper arises, and Vincent's side-business, pirating copies on E.T on VHS in the backroom of the showroom, continues to roll out in his absence.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cosby: Fall of an American Icon
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of how US comedy giant and African-American role model Bill Cosby finally came to face a criminal trial for sexual assault a decade after the accusations were made, with proceedings set to start in Pennsylvania today. The film explores why it took so long for allegations that he was privately drugging and raping women with impunity to be taken seriously, with accusations from numerous women having fallen on deaf ears for years, and hears from journalists, co-stars and alleged victims.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: Pakistan v South Africa. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at Edgbaston in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A round-up of reports on spring, including Matt Baker examining the return of tulips to Lincolnshire's farmland and Ellie Harrison investigating an influx of migrating jellyfish in Cornwall. Adam Henson gets the chance to be an auctioneer at Exeter's livestock market, and Steve Brown discovers how one of the wonders of the season can only be appreciated in the dark. Plus, a taste of spring with chef Paul Ainsworth.(n)

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Nature's Wildest Weapons: Horns, Tusks and Antlers: Natural World.
programme.desc: Professor Doug Emlen examines how animals use their bodies as weapons in epic battles to gore, stab, crush and batter their adversaries to death, from elephants to rhinoceros beetles, assessing whether they are more than just instruments of blunt force. For the professor this has been a lifetime's ambition to discover the secrets of nature's arms races, what triggers them and what they can teach us about the most formidable weapons on Earth - our own.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British policeman leads an armed raid on the home of a man feared to have a gun, and a UK flying doctor fights to save a farmer's wife who is badly injured.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: The team explore the truth behind supermarket deals and offers, and also report on the so called 'healthy' snacks sold as an alternative to sweets at supermarket tills.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Culinary challenge hosted by Sheree Murphy in which michelin starred chef Rupert Rowley puts three home cooks through a series of challenges, including how to make a crepe suzette.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: The four remaining teams of professional pastry chefs create 36 identical petite charlottes and 36 shaped macarons in two hours. For their final challenge the teams must put an innovative spin on the classic towering French celebration cake, the croquembouche, all of which will be judged by Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin. Angus Deayton hosts.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: Wendy Brightwell is reunited with her half-brother Rod and introduces him to her children for the first time. Cameras also follow Margaret Teague's emotional family journey when she meets Mark, the brother who didn't know she existed.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Paudge's suspicious superiors swoop against `Beady' Burke's gang, gambling on gaining leverage over him, while David tempts Katie to a new home.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Britain's love of cheese has evolved over centuries, travelling to Scotland to sample some of its finest varieties and discovering that the original cheesecake recipes were not American but British.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: Jonathan Scott is in Tsavo, where one of the older orphans is diagnosed with a possible heart condition, while Michaela Strachan follows the separation of two elephants when Makena joins the older animals at the Ithumba release site.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Following the efforts being made by scientists, conservationists and local people in the Highlands as they work to repair the damage of the past and rebuild wild landscapes and habitats. The programme meets Dave Anderson from Forestry Commission Scotland and his colleague Simon Smith as they tag and monitor red kite and osprey chicks, gaining a unique perspective of the lives of the birds before they fly the nest. Cameras also capture the efforts of the Scottish Wildcat Action Plan team, as well as Paul Lister's project to reintroduce wolves and bears to his Alladale Wilderness Reserve. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Braxton and Helen Hall begin their journey in Wallingford, Oxfordshire, before travelling to Weybridge in Surrey. Later, they try to sell their purchases for a profit at an auction in Wokingham, Berkshire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: Olympic champion rower Helen Glover talks about wildlife in the water, there is a peak behind the scenes, and Chris Packham and Lindsey Chapman take viewers' questions and comments.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Part two of two. Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo continues his travels through Switzerland from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross, tries his hand at watchmaking, and takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Phil Carmichael, Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Wales final.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan report live on the latest from the National Trust's Sherborne Estate in the heart of the Cotswolds. Martin Hughes-Games and Iolo Williams pit two birds against each other in a challenge to see which is the ultimate hunter, and Gillian Burke reports on some fascinating new science.(n)

programme.title: Paula
programme.desc: Mac recovers from the attack, but faces repercussions at work. He continues to delve into James's past, discovering stories of a troubled childhood. Meanwhile, as if things couldn't get any worse for Paula, she faces the possibility that Callum may never recover and is haunted by the danger James poses. So she resolves to confront him one last time - but this time she is prepared for a fight. Denise Gough, Tom Hughes and Owen McDonnell star in the conclusion of the thriller, by Olivier and Tony-award winning writer Conor McPherson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.(n)

programme.title: Frankie Boyle's New World Order
programme.desc: New series. The comedian tries to make sense of the modern world, using a combination of stand-up, review, discussion and audience interaction to dissect the week's news - with a panel of guests on hand to take Frankie to task over his claims. Guests on the first show include fellow comic Sara Pascoe.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties during the election, filmed on the afternoon of transmission. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: India v Sri Lanka. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at The Oval.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to London's West End as he explores 19th-century engineering used in theatres, and learns about the ambitious building programme that saw Trafalgar Square replace slums. He indulges in some retail therapy at a Piccadilly Circus perfumery patronised by kings, queens and prime ministers, and finds out how diseases were rife in Victorian London on a visit to Soho.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Built the Liners.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hard-working culture that existed in the Clyde shipyards, which were responsible for making the Queen Mary and QE2, despite poor working conditions and industrial relations. The programme examines how the employees' work ethic and strength of public support led them to defy the then-government's efforts to close the factories down in 1971.(n)

programme.title: Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa
programme.desc: Michael Sheen takes the lead role in a drama based on Kenneth Williams' diaries. The film charts the comic actor's professional successes, which included the Carry On series, radio programmes such as Round the Horne and numerous TV appearances. It also delves behind the laughter to explore the actor's problems, insecurity and self-doubt.(n)

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: In a programme first broadcast in 1995, Michael Parkinson looks back at memorable moments from his interviews with actor Kenneth Williams. Among other topics, the Carry On star discusses his dislike of theatre critics, and reveals his grievances with Parkinson himself. He also performs a rendition of My Crepes Suzette. With appearances by John Betjeman, Maggie Smith, Frank Muir, Tom Lehrer, Robin Ray and Patrick Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Locomotion: Dan Snow's History of Railways
programme.desc: The historian and broadcaster charts the development of the UK's rail network, from its beginnings as a primitive system of trackways for coal carts in the early 18th century up to the present day. Rapid industrial growth during the 19th century, coupled with the prospect of vast profits, drove inventors and entrepreneurs to develop steam locomotives, metal tracks and an array of daring tunnels, cuttings and bridges that created a nationwide system of railways in just 30 years. George Stephenson's Liverpool and Manchester Railway became the model for future inter-city travel and his fast, reliable locomotive the Rocket began a quest for speed that has defined the modern world.(n)

programme.title: Soup Cans & Superstars: How Pop Art Changed the World
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke examines the history of the art movement, bringing a fresh eye to the work of superstars Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein and tracking down pioneers including James Rosenquist, Claes Oldenburg, Ed Ruscha, Peter Blake and Allen Jones. He also explores pop art's fascination with celebrity, advertising and the mass media, and travels to China to discover how a new generation of artists is reinventing it for the 21st century.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Decadence & Downfall - The Shah of Iran's Ultimate Party.
programme.desc: The story of a famously lavish five-day party held by the Shah of Iran in 1971 to celebrate 2,500 years of Persian monarchy. The event was held at a specially constructed oasis surrounded by a city of tents and attended by 60 world leaders, who enjoyed a five-course banquet and a pageant featuring thousands of soldiers dressed in historical costume. However, the decadence on display had far-reaching consequences, breeding resentment of the Shah's regime among the Iranian people.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Built the Liners.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hard-working culture that existed in the Clyde shipyards, which were responsible for making the Queen Mary and QE2, despite poor working conditions and industrial relations. The programme examines how the employees' work ethic and strength of public support led them to defy the then-government's efforts to close the factories down in 1971.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen host the 20th anniversary edition of the music show, first broadcast on January 5, 1984, featuring Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Rod Stewart, Status Quo, Frank Kelly, Slade and the Flying Pickets, as well as archive footage of artists to have appeared over the years.(n)

programme.title: The Wonderful World of Blood - with Michael Mosley
programme.desc: Documentary in which Michael Mosley undergoes six experiments in order to take an in-depth look at blood, including injecting it with snake venom to demonstrate its ability to clot within seconds, and starving it of oxygen to see how it instantly responds. Michael also discovers how it tastes when he tries some black pudding made from his own blood.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Investigating the story of how a Russian internet millionaire, Dmitry Itskov, is turning to cutting-edge science to try to unlock the secret of living for ever. The programme investigates the real science inspiring his bold plan to upload the human mind to a computer, and examines whether his goal of bringing about immortality for humans within thirty years is attainable.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Giants
programme.desc: Tom Wrigglesworth and Rob Bell visit a dry dock in Newcastle, where they witness long-serving North Sea ferry the Pride of Bruges receiving a complete overhaul to extend its working life. The duo explore the inner workings of the 32,000-ton ship, which has transported passengers between Hull and the Belgian port of Zeebrugge for more than a quarter of a century, and travel to a ship-breaking yard to learn how ferries are recycled when they are no longer fit for service. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Planet Oil
programme.sub-title: Planet Oil: The Treasure That Conquered the World.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines how the fuel has come to dominate the modern world, visiting the places that gave birth to the earth's oil riches, exploring the stories of the people who fought over its control and supply and looking at how mankind's insatiable thirst for oil is changing the planet. In the first episode he looks at how 19th-century amateur geologist George Bissell went searching for oily puddles in Pennsylvania that he had a hunch could be the source of a new kind of fuel, and follows the story on through the development of products that could light homes, and in turn provide power for the newly emerging mass car market.(n)

It's game, set, drama when the other wives attend the match. Meanwhile, Jill shows her home redesign to Bethenny; and Bethenny seeks help with her product-logo design(n)

However, a forensic blunder puts the case in jeopardy - and Delko gets the blame.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 309. Singer Ingrid Michaelson joins a would-be entrepreneur who's pitching high-tech music software. programme.desc: Episode 613. Also: Lori Greiner offers an update on her "All-Stars."(n)

programme.desc: Episode 726. A heated exchange takes place in the Season 7 finale when a Shark's temper is lost after an entrepreneur refuses an offer "for personal reasons."
