programme.title: Harvey
programme.desc: An amiable drunk claims to have a six-foot invisible rabbit named Harvey as a friend, to the horror of his social-climbing sister. Having been embarrassed by her brother once too often, she tries to have him committed to an asylum, but things do not go according to plan as her sibling's gentle nature wins over those around him. Comedy, starring James Stewart and Josephine Hull.(n)

programme.title: Damn the Defiant
programme.desc: The commander of a British warship fighting in the Napoleonic campaign faces bitter opposition from his right-hand man, a cruel and sadistic officer hated by the crew. In a battle of wills between the pair, the captain's second-in-command tries to provoke his leader's wrath by tormenting his son, an officer on the vessel. Drama, starring Alec Guinness, Dirk Bogarde and Anthony Quayle.(n)

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully.(n)

programme.title: Letters to Juliet
programme.desc: A writer on holiday in Italy discovers a 50-year-old letter from a woman describing her regret at rejecting a man she was in love with. She is moved to reply, prompting the writer to turn up in person with her grandson in tow, and together they set out in search of her lost love to put things right. Romantic drama, starring Amanda Seyfried, Vanessa Redgrave and Gael Garcia Bernal.(n)

programme.title: Surrogates
programme.desc: In the future, all human activity is performed by robot duplicates mentally controlled by their owners, who live lives of complete isolation. As a mysterious killer begins murdering both humans and their doubles, an FBI agent ventures into the real world for the first time in years to catch the criminal. Sci-fi thriller, starring Bruce Willis and Radha Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Grey
programme.desc: Eight oil rig workers end up stranded in the middle of the Alaskan tundra when the plane flying them home crashes. With limited supplies, they must make a gruelling journey across the icy wilderness to civilisation, but their situation is made more perilous when a pack of ferocious wolves begins stalking them. Adventure, starring Liam Neeson, Frank Grillo and Dermot Mulroney.(n)

programme.title: Baaria
programme.desc: The son of a shepherd family in Sicily experiences sweeping social changes in his country over the course of five decades. Outraged by the exploitation of the people by a local landowner, he becomes a campaigner for social change and ultimately a member of the Communist party. Drama, starring Francesco Scianna and Margareth Made. In Sicilian, Italian and English.(n)

programme.title: The Spoilers
programme.desc: Two successful gold prospectors team up with a saloon owner in 19th-century Alaska to protect their mining rights from an unscrupulous rival and a corrupt judge determined to get rich at their expense. Western, starring Anne Baxter, Jeff Chandler and Rory Calhoun.(n)

programme.title: None Shall Escape
programme.desc: German military officer Wilhelm Grimm is tried for crimes committed during the Second World War, and his life and career is shown in a series of flashbacks. Returning seriously injured and disenchanted from the Great War to a village on the German-Polish border, his subsequent actions caused him banishment from the community and he is attracted to the Nazi Party. Drama, starring Alexander Knox.(n)

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: The Last Sunset
programme.desc: A wanted murderer travels to Mexico to see the now-married love of his life, little realising he is being pursued by a determined sheriff. However, both the outlaw and the lawman end up working for the woman's husband on a cattle drive. Western, starring Rock Hudson, Kirk Douglas, Dorothy Malone and Joseph Cotten.(n)

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: A teenager discovers he is the last in a long line of warriors destined to defend the world from dark forces. His duty now is to embark on a perilous journey through time to recover the six parts of a powerful mystical artefact and ensure it is returned to safe hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Alexander Ludwig, Christopher Eccleston and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Lucy
programme.desc: A courier is kidnapped and forced to become a drug mule. When she is exposed to the experimental chemicals she is smuggling, it boosts her intelligence and reflexes to superhuman levels. She uses her newfound abilities to get revenge on her captors, but as the process continues, she evolves into something more than human. Sci-fi thriller, starring Scarlett Johansson and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Haywire
programme.desc: A mercenary is employed by the US government to carry out secret assignments, but on her latest mission, she is set up by one of the operatives who hired her. She fights her way through the world of international espionage in search of revenge, fending off assassins as she tries to find out who betrayed her. Action thriller, starring Gina Carano, Ewan McGregor, Michael Fassbender and Antonio Banderas.(n)

programme.title: En busca de la ciudad perdida
Hasta que la boda nos separe
Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares a roast beef and horseradish sandwich for lunch.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten helps a bride-to be who is having problems planning her rehearsal dinner. She prepares two desserts while Miguel Flores-Vianna designs two table settings.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Running a store isn't easy, and Ina should know - she ran a deli for 20 years. Ina suggests a French-inspired menu of Provencal soup, seafood and coconut madeleines for dessert as a staff thank you.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals her cooking secrets. Ina sends a food lover's delight to a friend in the city. The package consists of a beautiful fillet of beef and a perfect plum tart.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares heirloom tomato salad, corn shrimp fritters with cucumber remoulade, and chicken terrine with ham and onion marmalade at a local winery farm-to-table event.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The cook prepares brunch, including fruit and nut muesli, eggs Benedict with peameal on scallion, waffles with tomato cream, summer sunshine smoothies, and a moist date raisin loaf.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Ezra and Julie waltz in on a group of ballroom and Latin dance instructors. Can they shake up the dance floor and the kitchen with their new menu.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Kitchen Confessional: Dinner Through the Decades.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond confesses about her life on a plate, from beef stroganoff that she loved as a child of the 70s, to pasta ai quattro formaggi that defined her student life in LA.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree puts a breakfast spin on four dinners, starting with sausage kale strata. Wild rice pancakes get flipped to dinnertime for the girls, while the boys enjoy breakfast quesadillas.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While Ree Drummond's daughter Alex and her friends have a dorm room craft day at college, Ree makes green chili chicken, spicy taco potatoes, layered Mexican salad and key lime pie.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: As the guys are away, Ree Drummond makes a blueberry crumb cake for breakfast, and petite filets with wasabi cilantro cream, lobster mac and cheese and lemony broccolini for dinner.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Eight well-known chefs set off on a road trip to compete in some of the most demanding cookery contests around the UK, with two taking part each week. The first duo are Ed Baines and Valentine Warner, who begin by putting their roulades up for scrutiny at the Otley Show in West Yorkshire, and not only are they taking on each other, they are pitted against the best local cooks.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Ed Baines and Valentine Warner continue their culinary road trip, heading to London for the Lambeth Country Show to prepare an entry for the garden vegetable cake category. They also visit nearby Brixton Village Market, where Ning Ma and her mother Mama Lan let them in on their family recipe for prawn, egg and Chinese chive dumplings.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patricia treats her make up artists to a special pampering party. On the menu is a cucumber sparkler, chicken lettuce cups, avocado hummus and crab cakes.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patricia Heaton reunites with some of the stars of the movie Mom's Night Out. To celebrate, Patty creates a fiesta night menu with bacon queso, steak fajitas and churros.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul visits the city of Jerusalem, spending time with traditional bakers. Inspired, he creates his own Jerusalem bagel bread, and almond and pomegranate loaf cake.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While Ree's husband Ladd and his father Chuck dismantle a historic cattle feed storehouse, she cooks them a lunch of juicy steak and eggs benedict.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Ed Baines and Valentine Warner head for Brighton to prepare a hot sauce to enter into a competition at the UK Chilli Festival, where their efforts are assessed by no fewer than four judges. They also meet local food producer Galia Orme, who runs a company supplying chocolate-making kits across the country.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Ed Baines and Valentine Warner travel to North Yorkshire, where they enter the `Packed Lunch for Two' category in the Stokesley Show, aiming to impress judge Christine Tenant. The pair also head to Whitby to visit a family-run fish smokers that was established more than 100 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: This time, funny cookies and a lean meat are part of the appetiser basket puzzle as the young chefs compete to impress the judges.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul gets a guided tour around Cape Town's best baking hotspots, and later creates two bakes of his own - Earl Grey milk tart and BBQ meat pasties.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a restaurant in Cambridge, Massachusetts, serving up confit pork belly corn dog.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: After opening a successful pizza restaurant, Anthony thought branching off with Trovato's Due would be a piece of cake. Now, he's drowning in debt and has called in Willie for help.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine is just outside of San Francisco, where he is on a mission to save Estrada's. This Mexican restaurant has been a staple in Daly City for 96 years.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a Brazilian restaurant is concerned that the meat sales are not being reflected in his profit, so asks the team to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners

programme.desc: Guy Fieri samples buttermilk biscuits in Portland, Oregon, a soft-shell crab BLT in San Anselmo, California, and bagels with matzo ball soup in Florida.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine faces the challenge of saving struggling restaurants in two days with a budget of $10,000. This time, he finds out why the Caseyville Cafe in Illinois is failing.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Marigny Brasserie, New Orleans has noticed an influx of rowdy tourists at his `locals' bar', so the Mystery Diners investigate who is profiting from the new customers.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing rumours of his restaurant's signature cocktail being served at other bars, the owner of Victory, New Orleans contacts the Mystery Diners for help.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks a lunch of swordfish steaks in tomato caper sauce, saffron and courgette couscous followed by individual chocolate puddings.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: The delightful Ina Garten has some fun with her favourite fruity desserts. There's an explosive summer pudding, rum and raisin rice pudding and a classic key lime pie.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina has the solution to the scariest nightmare - your boss coming to dinner. Everyone's expecting something fancy so surprise them with the best comfort food - turkey meatloaf.(n)

programme.desc: Ezra and Julie meet up with a group of cattle wranglers who love eating burgers and lots of protein. Can they spur the dude ranch into making healthier food choices?.(n)

programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.(n)

programme.desc: Ree is celebrating Friendsgiving frontier-style with a turkey roulade rolled around sausage stuffing and a leek and potato casserole.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond, Ladd and the extended family get together for some good old friendly ranch-style sporting competition.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Chefs Ed Baines and Valentine Warner reach the end of the culinary road trip in North Yorkshire, making date and walnut scones for the Nidderdale Show - where they face the scrutiny of judge Julie Clarke. They also visit Susannah Vickers, who runs a mobile service teaching people how to bake bread - and she has some hints and tips for the two professionals as well.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Jun Tanaka and Galton Blackiston set off on a culinary road trip to compete in cookery contests around the UK. The pair also meet prize-winning angler Les Mason and receive a quick fishing lesson.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: This time, thee competitors confront a weird tasting soft drink and funny-shaped grapes as they do their best to try and impress the judges.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The celebrity chef visits historic Sicilian capital of Palermo where he discovers its rich street culture and Arabic influenced food markets selling local specialities.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity causes mayhem when a Russian hitman is sent after the wrong target.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin takes on the bureaucracy of office politics when he discovers his work space has been cut in half. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: George is forced to return to Ultron to attend a superhero refresher course, leaving Janet holding the baby - until the Council provides her with a clone of her husband for company. Unfortunately, the stand-in turns out to be a devious cad with a hidden agenda that threatens George's position on Earth.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household is disrupted by a pesky plumber whose penchant for morbid practical jokes would try the patience of a saint. David Renwick's award-winning comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: Comedy highlights, courtesy of the frantic funnyman with the fez, featuring his unique style of magical illusion.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy becomes a yuppie, complete with red braces, Filofax and chrome briefcase. Meanwhile, Rodney begins attending a computer course at night school, where he meets Cassandra. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael reveals surprising news to his parents, but Susan is more shocked by Ben's reaction. Comedy, starring Gabriel Thomson, Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: George is forced to return to Ultron to attend a superhero refresher course, leaving Janet holding the baby - until the Council provides her with a clone of her husband for company. Unfortunately, the stand-in turns out to be a devious cad with a hidden agenda that threatens George's position on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin takes on the bureaucracy of office politics when he discovers his work space has been cut in half. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household is disrupted by a pesky plumber whose penchant for morbid practical jokes would try the patience of a saint. David Renwick's award-winning comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager.
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael reveals surprising news to his parents, but Susan is more shocked by Ben's reaction. Comedy, starring Gabriel Thomson, Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The family has a spare invitation for the wedding, so Mrs Khan suggests giving it to the Parvez family. But her husband thinks the fewer guests the better and would rather have the influential Councillor Javed at the celebration. The decision is not an easy one to make - and to complicate matters, today just happens to be his own anniversary. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Rapid-fire comedy sketch show, featuring Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Arabella Weir and Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Micky Flanagan, Jason Byrne and Seann Walsh.
programme.desc: Micky Flanagan hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing routines by Jason Byrne and Seann Walsh, with all three sharing their comical observations on life.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret are trapped in the shed by a swarm of escaped bees - and not unexpectedly where the mishap-prone Meldrews are concerned, that is just the start of their troubles. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager.
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.desc: Tom Good decides he has had enough of commuting - but his alternative method causes embarrassment among the well-to-do neighbours. First episode of the classic comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara introduce livestock into suburban Surbiton - an idea that does not go down too well with the neighbours. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The family has a spare invitation for the wedding, so Mrs Khan suggests giving it to the Parvez family. But her husband thinks the fewer guests the better and would rather have the influential Councillor Javed at the celebration. The decision is not an easy one to make - and to complicate matters, today just happens to be his own anniversary. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Rapid-fire comedy sketch show, featuring Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Arabella Weir and Caroline Aherne.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: Ten amateur celebrity cooks board a cruise ship heading across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen. Their talents are judged by chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White. Each episode follows the untrained chefs as the ship sails from port to port and they discover charming and captivating stories about each location and the food that is grown and produced locally.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve contestants begin the battle to be named Britain's best amateur baker, facing tasks devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, who have created 30 new tasks to test their baking skills and creativity. Their first signature challenge is to make a Madeira cake, before they attempt to bake a frosted walnut cake in the technical. Day two of the contest sees the contestants going all out to try and impress the judges with their first showstopper, the Black Forest gateau. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the fourth quarter-final and the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from kitchen scraps, including bones and offcuts, fish skins, overripe fruit, cheese and stale bread. After an elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, William Sitwell and Jay Rayner, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate some of their favourite indulgent dishes for entertaining guests, receiving money-saving tips from Michelin-starred chef Tom Kitchin and delving into British culinary history for gourmet inspiration. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they help a lifeboat helmsman say a surprise thank you to his crew.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Austens from West Sussex, whose income has reduced by a third since mum Denise recently gave up work. However, the family are guilty of stockpiling food to the point where they cannot open the fridge door without items falling out - and they are utterly devoted to high-end brands, refusing to buy anything other than their favourite labels.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Battlechefs
programme.desc: Ten amateur celebrity cooks board a cruise ship heading across the Mediterranean, taking it in turns to command the kitchen. Using the cooking techniques they have acquired, each tries to impress chef and restaurateur Marco Pierre White. All competitors help prepare the meal, but also get a chance to score each other.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With the cake week completed, and one of their number already eliminated from the competition, the 11 remaining home bakers must now prove their skill at making biscuits, a task that can be deceptively difficult, and one that has undone many a confident Bake Off contestant in the past. The opening signature challenge this week is to create 24 biscotti, Italian delicacies that must be baked twice to deliver the perfect crisp crunch. Next is Paul Hollywood's technical challenge, in which the contestants tackle Arlettes - labour-intensive, puff pastry-based treats from southwest France. Finally, for the showstopper, the judges demand bespoke edible biscuit boxes, filled with 36 biscuits of different flavours. After all three rounds have concluded, it falls to Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins to announce which of the bakers will be asked to leave the tent.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition, the 12 remaining contenders come together to compete in the semi-finals. They face an Invention test that features an abundant selection of meat, fish, fruit, vegetables and herbs and spices to choose from, but must go back to basics as all the modern machines are removed from the kitchen. Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace then choose the best eight to go straight through, leaving the four weakest to cook off for the two remaining places in the competition.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a gourmet party on a tight budget, preparing cut-price canapes, cakes and tasty treats, with Michelin-starred chef Nigel Haworth giving advice on vegetarian food. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise celebration for 35 farm volunteers.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip brings him to northern Greece where he enjoys traditional dishes including veal stiffado and kotopita - which Rick declares to be the best chicken pie he has ever tasted. In the coastal city of Preveza he goes out prawn fishing and follows in the footsteps of poet Lord Byron visiting Messolonghi, a city where seafood is a highly regarded commodity. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help Clare and Richard from Hatfield, Hertfordshire, who are so busy with work and looking after two young children they have found themselves stuck in a rather unusual rut - seven years ago they devised a weekly meal plan - Monday is pizza, Wednesday is spaghetti bolognese and so on - and it hasn't changed since. Not only this, but they always buy big brands and premium supermarket ranges, which is an expensive way to shop for what has become a boring way to eat. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With the cake week completed, and one of their number already eliminated from the competition, the 11 remaining home bakers must now prove their skill at making biscuits, a task that can be deceptively difficult, and one that has undone many a confident Bake Off contestant in the past. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a gourmet party on a tight budget, preparing cut-price canapes, cakes and tasty treats, with Michelin-starred chef Nigel Haworth giving advice on vegetarian food. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise celebration for 35 farm volunteers.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition, the 12 remaining contenders come together to compete in the semi-finals. They face an Invention test that features an abundant selection of meat, fish, fruit, vegetables and herbs and spices to choose from, but must go back to basics as all the modern machines are removed from the kitchen. Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace then choose the best eight to go straight through, leaving the four weakest to cook off for the two remaining places in the competition.(n)

programme.title: World's Best Restaurants
programme.desc: An eatery in Catalonia twice voted the best in the world, quintessentially French dining in the heart of rural Japan, and a dazzling Las Vegas establishment.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip brings him to northern Greece where he enjoys traditional dishes including veal stiffado and kotopita - which Rick declares to be the best chicken pie he has ever tasted. In the coastal city of Preveza he goes out prawn fishing and follows in the footsteps of poet Lord Byron visiting Messolonghi, a city where seafood is a highly regarded commodity. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help Clare and Richard from Hatfield, Hertfordshire, who are so busy with work and looking after two young children they have found themselves stuck in a rather unusual rut - seven years ago they devised a weekly meal plan - Monday is pizza, Wednesday is spaghetti bolognese and so on - and it hasn't changed since. Not only this, but they always buy big brands and premium supermarket ranges, which is an expensive way to shop for what has become a boring way to eat. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With the cake week completed, and one of their number already eliminated from the competition, the 11 remaining home bakers must now prove their skill at making biscuits, a task that can be deceptively difficult, and one that has undone many a confident Bake Off contestant in the past. The opening signature challenge this week is to create 24 biscotti, Italian delicacies that must be baked twice to deliver the perfect crisp crunch. Next is Paul Hollywood's technical challenge, in which the contestants tackle Arlettes - labour-intensive, puff pastry-based treats from southwest France. Finally, for the showstopper, the judges demand bespoke edible biscuit boxes, filled with 36 biscuits of different flavours. After all three rounds have concluded, it falls to Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins to announce which of the bakers will be asked to leave the tent.(n)

Fed up with being torn apart, the girls each reject the their respective cliques and reclaim their own group where friendship takes precedence over popularity. Unfortunately, this causes the school's tyrannical student-body president to blow a gasket, and it looks like they'll have to fight hard for their place in the crowd(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: A comic battle of wills ensues when five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam in 1968 grudgingly agree to undertake the mission of a life-time - to secretly transport an 8,000 lib elephant through 200 miles of jungle! Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing..(n)

Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. But avoiding his fate is not going to be an easy task to fulfill because an ambitious man of the government will put the world again in danger and start another round of the war between good and evil. The visions will return to Sams brain and he is not going to be able to ignore them. Despite he did not really want to, he finds himself back with his friends in the middle of a battle between the Autobots and Decepticons, and with the future of the whole universe in his hands(n)

programme.desc: The most popular fashion dolls in America make the leap to the big screen in this live-action adventure that follows four diverse teenage girls who make the jump from middle school to high school, only to find that their four-part friendship doesn't fit into the rigid clique system at their new institution. Fed up with being torn apart, the girls each reject the their respective cliques and reclaim their own group where friendship takes precedence over popularity. Unfortunately, this causes the school's tyrannical student-body president to blow a gasket, and it looks like they'll have to fight hard for their place in the crowd(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: A comic battle of wills ensues when five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam in 1968 grudgingly agree to undertake the mission of a life-time - to secretly transport an 8,000 lib elephant through 200 miles of jungle! Comic chaos is the result of this effort to foster goodwill with the locals, as the mis-matched bunch of soldiers take on their jumbo task!(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: In this icy and stylish sci-fi thriller, a dying New York real-estate tycoon undergoes a top-secret procedure to transfer his consciousness into the body of a healthy young man, but he discovers that his new life isn't what he expected after severing ties to his old one and learning about the mysterious origins of his new body(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: Hitchcock spoof with Mel Brooks as the new head of the Institute of the Very, Very Nervous. Among the films receiving the Brooks treatment are The Birds, Psycho and Vertigo(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: John Travolta is back as Mafia loanshark turned Hollywood Producer Chili Palmer in this sequel to GET SHORTY. This time, Chili finds himself mixing it up in the rough and tumble world of rock stars, pop divas, and hip hop gangstas when a new idea for a movie leads him into the music business. Will his wise guy attitude succeed in the ever-changing world of music or will more people just end up dead?(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 145. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Jason Bourne emerges from seclusion to reenter the world of high-stakes espionage(n)

programme.title: Making of 'All Eyez on Me'
programme.desc: A look at "All Eyez on Me," a 2017 biopic of legendary rapper Tupac Shakur that chronicles his rise to fame and untimely death at the age of 25. The film stars Demetrius Shipp Jr., Danai Gurira and Lauren Cohan, and is directed by Benny Boom(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: The Book of Nora. Answers are elusive in the series finale(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: 06-04-2017. Gilfoyle takes on Jian-Yang's new smart fridge(n)

programme.title: Warning: This Drug May Kill You
programme.desc: A look at opioid addiction in the U.S. profiles four families whose lives have been decimated by drug abuse that began with legitimate prescriptions to dangerous painkillers that are often a gateway to heroin(n)

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: Tom Hanks stars in this portrait of airline pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger, which depicts his successful emergency landing of an Airbus A320 on the Hudson River in January 2009. In the aftermath of this unprecedented and heroic feat, the traumatized pilot must endure second-guessing by investigators, the weight of sudden fame, and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day. Anna Gunn, Laura Linney, and Aaron Eckhart co-star. Directed by Clint Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Ben Sasse; Tristan Harris; Eliot Spitzer; Rebecca Traister; Jim VandeHei
programme.desc: Ben Sasse; Tristan Harris; Eliot Spitzer; Rebecca Traister; Jim VandeHei. Sen. Ben Sasse (R-Neb.) and Time Well Spent cofounder Tristan Harris are the interview guests. The panelists are former New York governor Eliot Spitzer, journalist Rebecca Traister and Axios cofounder Jim VandeHei(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 05/23/2017. Segments include a report on abuse in youth soccer programs in England; a profile of the Dodgers' Spanish broadcaster Jaime Jarrin; and a visit with Robert Gagno, the autistic defending winner of the World Pinball Championships(n)

programme.title: High Maintenance
programme.desc: Grandpa. A Midwestern transplant experiences culture shock when he settles in Queens with his dog, but an eccentric dog walker makes them feel right at home(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: (2007) America's favourite family make their debut on the big screen in David Silverman's comedy. When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing..(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy stars in a comedy remake of the 1960s spy series of the same name. A CIA agent teams up with a boxer for a secret mission to recover a super-plane from Budapest(n)

programme.title: Suited
programme.desc: A look at a tailoring company in Brooklyn that provides custom attire for LGBTQ clients features profiles of the owners and the diverse community they serve. Lena Dunham and Jenni Konner ("Girls") are producers(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Desperate to get their music heard on the radio, members of a heavy-metal band hold a radio station hostage(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: Freeman is hired to chauffeur the difficult Tandy in racially tense 1960's South. The two develop an eventual relationship and love for each other with terrific performances across the board and enough sincerity to break even the toughest audience(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake (Asa Butterfield) follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. Eva Green, Samuel L. Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier is asked to get back into her habit when her old friends at St Catherine's Convent find difficulty in controlling a school filled with juvenile delinquents. But convincing everyone that Deloris is a nun is going to be a challenge in itself(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Sam Witwicky wants his life back. After saving the universe of destruction in a battle between two warring races of robotic aliens, he wants to study at the University and spend the last moments before leaving with his girlfriend Mikaela. But avoiding his fate is not going to be an easy task to fulfill because an ambitious man of the government will put the world again in danger and start another round of the war between good and evil. The visions will return to Sams brain and he is not going to be able to ignore them. Despite he did not really want to, he finds himself back with his friends in the middle of a battle between the Autobots and Decepticons, and with the future of the whole universe in his hands(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski, the screenwriting team who penned Ed Wood, The People vs. Larry Flynt, and Man on the Moon, made their debut as directors with this broad comedy. Norm MacDonald stars as a chauffeur who decides to get revenge on his wealthy boss by kidnapping her dog. Produced under the titles Pittsburgh, Ballbusted, and Foolproof, Screwed also stars Danny De Vito, Dave Chappelle, Sherman Helmsley, Elaine Stritch, and Sarah Silverman(n)

programme.title: Mission to Mars
programme.desc: In 2020, astronauts are sent to rescue possible survivors of the first manned mission to Mars, which ended in apprent disaster, in this visually stunning space thriller(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Bonfire of the Vanities
programme.desc: Controversial adaptation of Tom Wolfe's acerbic novel. A successful Wall Street trader finds his charmed life turned into a shambles(n)

programme.desc: A look at "Now You See Me 2," the 2016 sequel to the 2013 thriller that follows the Four Horsemen's return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.desc: A wimp is forced into a fight with a possibly homicidal new student. He has until the end of the school day to escape the confrontation(n)

Evan Bonifant, Nia Peeples, Kathleen Freeman, Frank Oz, Steve Lawrence, Erykah Badu, Darrell Hammond. Directed by John Landis(n)

programme.desc: Comedy starring and co-written by Ice Cube, who plays a young street dweller who struggles to avoid the dangerous pitfalls - drugs, gang-related warfare and death - on the streets of South Central Los Angeles(n)

programme.desc: Jeff Stilson. Jeff Stilson's routine covers a range of subjects, including divorce, men in delivery rooms, and math problems regarding bungee jumping. Taped in San Francisco at the Fillmore Auditorium(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall

programme.title: Bulletproof

James Earl Jones, Margaret Avery, Joy Bryant, Cedric the Entertainer. Written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up glamorous hooker Rebecca De Mornay. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Cruise's house, she has an idea - seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking(n)

The real criminals managed to escape and frame Miss Piggy as the thief. Kermit, Fozzie and the Great Gonzo set out on a mission to solve the mystery and track down the criminals who stole the Baseball Diamond. There are fewer star cameos and songs in The Great Muppet Caper than in The Muppet Movie, although appearances from John Cleese and Charles Grodin are particularly memorable(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. Mia Thermopolis is a pleasant, if slightly awkward and geeky, 15-year-old high school student living in San Francisco. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Can Mia prove her regal relative wrong?(n)

programme.title: 101 Dalmatians
programme.desc: After their puppies are stolen by an evil fashonista, two Dalmatians round up their owners for a rescue(n)

programme.title: 102 Dalmatians

programme.title: The Princess Diaries 2 - Royal Engagement
programme.desc: Princess Mia settles in Genovia, but is required to be wed before she can assume the crown of her country. Her grandmother urges her to go for an arranged marriage(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: In this charming animated fantasy, a stork and his human pal must team up to transport a baby girl to her expectant family—despite the fact that storks now work as couriers for an Internet merchant after getting out of the baby-delivery business(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A group of kids defend their Maine vacation home from knee-high alien invaders in this adventure comedy. Shortly after Bethany Pearson (Ashley Tisdale) and her family arrive at their summer home, four aliens show up and enslave her boyfriend Ricky via a powerful mind-control device. While the adults are completely oblivious to the extraterrestrial threat, the kids fight to save the planet with a little help from Sparks, the one friendly alien(n)

programme.title: The Green Inferno
programme.desc: In this gruesome tribute to the Italian cannibal films of yesteryear, a group of young American activists on a mission to save the rain forest are captured by a sadistic tribe of flesh-eating locals(n)

programme.title: Assassins
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone stars as a seasoned hitman who has to face off against a younger, better looking rival in Antonio Banderas in Richard Donner's quick-fire action(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Cop Land
programme.desc: Complex police drama about a New York Internal Affairs agent who attempts to uncover the truth behind the apparent suicide of a policeman who shot dead two black youths. Arriving in the town to which the officer absconded, he joins forces with the town's troubled, disrespected sheriff, who himself has some demons to lay to rest(n)

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: In this action epic set during the Han dynasty, a Chinese commander joins forces with a Roman general to protect China's sovereignty from a power-hungry villain(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery is the adventurer who joins Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Dorian Gray and other fictional heroes to save the world. FX-packed comic book action(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: Batman is back for his wildest, most outrageous adventure to date, facing a dangerous combination of arch-enemies intent on his destruction. George Clooney is the new caped crusader, aided and abetted by Robin (Chris O'Donnell) and, for the first time in the series, by Batgirl (Alicia Silverstone), a feisty fellow freedom fighter! This time, our heroes must confront Mr Freeze (Arnold Schwarzenegger), a cold-hearted villain with an icy touch who has teamed up with the desirable yet deadly Poison Ivy (Uma Thurman), a woman with a kiss to die for - literally. With the help of his trusty butler Alfred (Michael Gough) and a dazzling array of new gadgets and vehicles, Batman and his partners must put a stop to Ivy and Mr Freeze before they succeed in their plan to conquer the entire world(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: In this "super-antihero" movie directed by David Ayer (Fury), a team of incarcerated villains -- including Deadshot (Will Smith), Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), El Diablo (Jay Hernandez), Killer Croc (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje), Enchantress (Cara Delevingne), and Captain Boomerang (Jai Courtney) -- are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences. Jared Leto makes a cameo appearance as the Joker. Joel Kinnaman and Viola Davis co-star. Based on the DC Comics series(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Back in the late 1970s, author Cameron Crowe banked upon his youthful appearance to pose as a teen-aged high school student. The results of his hands-on research was the revelatory book Fast Times at Ridgemont High, which went on to spectacular success as a theatrical feature. The sociological inner lining of Crowe's book was sacrificed in favor of standard teen-movie dialogue and Animal House-style comedy, but the film is impossible to dislike, and it spawned a legion of future imitators. Ostensibly, the main characters are brother and sister Jennifer Jason Leigh and Judge Reinhold. However, the real breakthrough star is Sean Penn as the perpetually zoned-out Jeff Spicoli. It is Penn who has the film's most famous scene, wherein the decorum of teacher Hand (Ray Walston)'s classroom is interrupted by a pizza delivery. Fast Times at Ridgemont High was spun off into a TV series, the short-lived 1986 weekly Fast Times(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young driver, Speed Racer, aspires to be champion of the racing world with the help of his family and his high-tech Mach 5 automobile(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: In this irreverent spin on the superhero genre, mercenary Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) agrees to participate in a top-secret experiment after learning that he has terminal cancer. When the procedure leaves him with advanced healing powers and a disfigured face, he reinvents himself as a wisecracking, spandex-clad antihero known as Deadpool, and seeks revenge on those responsible. Morena Baccarin, Ed Skrein, T.J. Miller, and Gina Carano co-star. Directed by Tim Miller(n)

programme.title: Bringing Out the Dead

Brian Helgeland's historical sports drama/biopic 42 relates the historic 1947 baseball season in which Brooklyn Dodgers general manager Branch Rickey (Harrison Ford) decides to sign the first black Major League player, Jackie Robinson (Chadwick Boseman). Although Robinson faces ugly, vicious racism from other clubs, fans, and on occasion his own teammates, Rickey encourages him to not fight back. By following that advice, Robinson allows his remarkable athletic talent to speak for itself, and soon the first-year player becomes one the most popular players on the team, eventually securing the Rookie of the Year award. Christopher Meloni and Hamish Linklater co-star(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Captain's Marriage
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Captain's Marriage. Captain Stottlemeyer (Ted Levine) is distracted from an ongoing murder investigation when he suspects that his wife Karen (Glenne Headly) is having an affair with arrogant young police sergeant Ryan Sharkey (Nicky Katt). Thus it is that Monk (Tony Shalhoub) must not only keep tabs on a murder witness named Gerald (Robert Clendenin), but he must also begin shadowing the elusive Karen. The rest of the story is a maelstrom of wounded feelings, sudden bursts of fisticuffs, and loud remonstrations...and wouldn't you know that, somehow, some way, the destinies of both Sgt. Sharkey and Gerald are inextricably linked?(n)

programme.title: The Last Cowboy
programme.desc: Jennie Garth and Bradly Cooper star in this touching story of a broken family who are forced to look deep into the past to change the furture. Charlie Bankston was a rancher and a cowboy who lived life to the fullest, and in doing so, he created an amazing legacy for those who knew him. But with his passing, the future of his beloved Dry Creek Ranch is uncertain. Charlie left the ranch to his granddaughter, Jake, a woman who long ago fled the homestead and all that it represented. In doing so, she left behind her father, Will, a man whom she blames for her mother's untimely death. Jake has returned now to claim what is rightfully hers - but the truth is that she can't afford to keep it. Can she and her father put aside years of bitterness to save what means the most to them?(n)

programme.title: Valhalla Rising
programme.desc: A man with a remarkable talent for violence must fight to survive when he sets out on an extraordinary journey in this fantasy from director Nicolas Winding Refn. One Eye (Mads Mikkelsen) is the nickname given to a nameless, mute warrior who has become a slave to Barde (Alexander Morton), a wealthy Scotsman who obtained One Eye for his remarkable fighting skills. One Eye is a fierce warrior but shows little loyalty to his master, and when the opportunity presents itself, One Eye murders Barde and his mercenaries and sets off on his own, with a young boy (Maarten Stevenson) tagging along to speak on his behalf. Eager to leave Denmark behind in favor of freedom and adventure, One Eye throws in his lot with a band of Christian Vikings, who've set out on an ambitious quest to travel to Jerusalem and claim the Holy Land as their own. But the voyage to the Holy City is a difficult one, and the Vikings are met with violent resistance, forcing One Eye to rely on his talents as a warrior to protect himself and his young apprentice. Valhalla Rising received its North American premiere at the 2009 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Escape from L.A.

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: Paul McGuigan's tricksy thriller stars Josh Hartnett as Slevin Kelevra, who arrives at his friend's New York apartment, only to find it empty. He makes himself at home, but his peace is interrupted by employees of crime lord The Boss, who mistake him for his absent friend, who owes The Boss $96,000. The Boss makes Slevin an offer: kill the son of his rival, The Rabbi, and the debt will be wiped clean. But The Rabbi soon gets hold of Slevin and makes a counter-offer. Meanwhile, cynical assassin Mr Goodkat is playing both ends against the middle in what might be a long-term plan, while Slevin's neighbour Lindsey soon becomes his love interest. The result is a multi-stranded double-cross that can only have one lucky winner..(n)

programme.title: Sucker Punch

programme.title: Exodus: Gods and Kings
programme.desc: Ridley Scott's Biblical epic Exodus: Gods and Kings stars Christian Bale as Moses who, as the film opens, fights alongside his brother Ramses (a shaved-headed Joel Edgerton), to help defend Egypt, which is ruled by their father, Seti (John Turturro). During battle, Moses saves Ramses life, causing Ramses to fear that his brother will one day be King because it fits with a prophecy handed down by one of Seti's trusted spiritualists. Soon after Seti's death, Moses, who is actually Jewish and not Egyptian, is banished. However, he becomes the leader of the Jewish people and leads a rebellion, with the help of a wrathful God, against that Egyptians(n)

programme.title: Balls of Fury
programme.desc: A disgraced former ping pong champion is drawn back into the world of high-stakes table tennis to carry out a top-secret mission in the feature directorial debut of Reno 911! writer/director Ben Garant. Far removed from the rigidly regulated world of professional sports, clandestine ping pong tournaments offer thrilling competition where only the strong survive. There was a time when the mere mention of the name Randy Daytona (Dan Fogler) was enough to make even those most hardened ping pong player cower in fear, but these days Randy has fallen out of favor with ping-pong fans. The former champ soon receives a much-needed shot at redemption, however, when he is recruited by a determined FBI agent named Rodriguez (George Lopez) to win a coveted spot in the upcoming underground table tennis tournament and ferret out the nefarious Feng (Christopher Walken), whose thriving criminal empire has transformed him into a true menace to society(n)

programme.title: The Comebacks
programme.desc: Lambeau Fields is a football coach who suffers from a streak of bad luck that has become the stuff of legend. As a last resort, he takes a job coaching a college football team populated with some of the least desirable players imaginable. He must pull this ragtag crew together in order to salvage his career(n)

programme.title: Kingpin
programme.desc: Seventeen years after a bad hustle left him with a mangled hand, ex-pro bowler Roy Munson (Woody Harrelson) finds his ticket back to the fast lane in a young Amish boy (Randy Quaid), whom he enters in a million-dollar winner-take-all bowling tournament in Reno. Bill Murray, Vanessa Angel, Chris Elliott, William Jordan, Richard Tyson, Lin Shaye(n)

programme.desc: A disgraced former ping pong champion is drawn back into the world of high-stakes table tennis to carry out a top-secret mission in the feature directorial debut of Reno 911! writer/director Ben Garant. Far removed from the rigidly regulated world of professional sports, clandestine ping pong tournaments offer thrilling competition where only the strong survive. There was a time when the mere mention of the name Randy Daytona (Dan Fogler) was enough to make even those most hardened ping pong player cower in fear, but these days Randy has fallen out of favor with ping-pong fans. The former champ soon receives a much-needed shot at redemption, however, when he is recruited by a determined FBI agent named Rodriguez (George Lopez) to win a coveted spot in the upcoming underground table tennis tournament and ferret out the nefarious Feng (Christopher Walken), whose thriving criminal empire has transformed him into a true menace to society(n)

In this mystery, Morse is introduced to trusty Sergeant Lewis (Kevin Whately) and takes it upon himself to investigate the apparent suicide of a lady friend. Co-starring Gemma Jones, Patrick Troughton, James Grout and Peter Woodthorpe.(n)

programme.title: The Knock
programme.desc: As a new boss takes over from Bill Adams, the customs investigators pursue a major drug baron and his partner, an American wheeler-dealer with a sideline in plutonium smuggling. Michael Brandon guest stars.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy wonders whether she is desirable, and Robin's lack of response leaves her downhearted. Comedy, starring Paula Wilcox and Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress thinks Mike's replacement PC Steve Crane is too anxious to prove his worth as he investigates a spate of farm break-ins on the moors, and Vernon causes chaos trying to impress new arrival Dr Liz Merrick with his community spirit. Elsewhere, Mike grows disillusioned with CID work. James Carlton and Aislin McGuckin star as the newcomers.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth has a surprise in store for hubby Simon, while Peggy and her family play host to unexpected visitors. Bittersweet drama, starring Sarah Lancashire and Pam Ferris, with Tony Haygarth, Thomas Craig and Marsha Thomason.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Du Plessis follows Sarah into the Bush to rescue the cheetah, but when disaster strikes, the Trevanions realise they will have to make new plans - and face a difficult decision about their future in Africa. Drama series, starring Amanda Holden and Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: Janet's great aunt makes an unannounced visit to the farm, while an outbreak of influenza interferes with lambing season.(n)

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A man dies suddenly of a mysterious fever and Holmes suspects murder, but a malign influence takes its toll on the detective as he delves into the underworld of London's docklands. Starring Jeremy Brett, with Roy Hudd.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An informant reveals two local hoodlums are planning to raid a shipment of gold bullion from Haworth Point, prompting Shiner to set up an ambush to catch the would-be thieves. Gina receives a visit from her niece, who has fallen in with a bad crowd back in Manchester, while Liz enlists David to paint the surgery and sitting room - but is less than pleased with the results. Drama, starring Simon Molloy and Tricia Penrose.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Brigid arrives at a decision and Lucy Klein is disturbed by the unscheduled reappearance of a figure from the past. Mr Harper rests on his laurels, certain the future is assured, while Ormerod and Weatherill reveal they are about to end their relationship - only to find the news is already common knowledge. Drama, starring Linda Armstrong, Polly Maberly and Robert Daws.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny and Evan find a sick hippo while on the run and risk being discovered in their bid to save it. Rosie meets Vanessa, the glamorous new owner of Mara who needs help with a lioness, and her only option is to act illegally to treat the animal. Georgina offers a delighted Fatani a job and De Lange agrees to fund Leopard's Den. Stephen Tompkinson, Luke Ward-Wilkinson and Lucy-Jo Hudson star.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin gets the chance to play for his college football team - but a cold threatens to earn him an early bath. Flat-share comedy, starring Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby asks Philip for a native charm to help him seduce the delectable Ruth - but his dreams of a romantic liaison soon go up in smoke. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Frances de la Tour, Richard Beckinsale and Don Warrington.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Mildred becomes broody and starts to dream of motherhood, much to George's dismay - and they consider adoption. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An informant reveals two local hoodlums are planning to raid a shipment of gold bullion from Haworth Point, prompting Shiner to set up an ambush to catch the would-be thieves.
