programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates when Seth disappears without trace, and discovers a link to a 20-year-old crime.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Shaun Evans returns as the young Inspector Morse in the first of four feature-length episodes. A baffling suicide, an anguished father searching for his missing daughter and the smash-and-grab robbery of medieval artefacts throw the detective in at the deep end as he resumes his role with Oxford City Police following a four-month absence from duty. As the locals go to the polls in a closely fought by-election and a beauty contest builds to its conclusion, Endeavour must navigate the choppy waters of both worlds as his investigation shakes the highest pillars of Oxford society. Co-starring Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, James Bradshaw, Jack Laskey and Sean Rigby.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A call girl is found murdered at an upmarket apartment, apparently the victim of a client who risks losing everything if his secret obsession with the woman is revealed. Leading the cross-examination, Phillips begins to suspect someone had a reason to frame the accused, and doggedly pursues the truth. Guest starring Greg Wise, with Bradley Walsh and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: A boy's body is discovered in a warehouse, in circumstances which could point to either suicide or murder. Dr Tony Hill takes on the case when DCI Carol Jordan is injured in an attempted mugging - and two more children's corpses are discovered. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green and Hermione Norris, with Mark Letheren and Emma Handy.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry is pleased when villainous old friend Jack `'Oily' Wragg returns to England, However, his pleasure melts away when he learns that there are old scores to settle and that Wragg intends to stage one final heist. Light-hearted crime drama, guest starring Pete Postlethwaite, with George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: Actress Diana Dors joins the incomparable comedian as he performs a variety of sketches and tricks. The ensemble cast features Peter Reeves and Clovissa Newcombe.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.desc: Highlights from the Superstock TT race at the prestigious motorcycling event from the Isle of Man. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the 11th day's play at Roland Garros, featuring the concluding men's and women's quarter-finals in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. Day 11 was particularly busy in 2016 due to a backlog of contests caused by heavy rain. Andy Murray was among those who booked their place in the semi-final, prevailing 5-7, 7-6, 6-0, 6-2 against home favourite Richard Gasquet. Eventual women's champion Garbine Muguruza and 2015 title-winner Stan Wawrinka also secured places in the last-four with straight-set victories over Shelby Rogers and Albert Ramos-Vinolas. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: The Unrideables
programme.desc: A look back at motorcycling in the late 1980s and early 1990s, which is widely regarded as one of the most exciting eras in the history of two-wheel racing and featured the likes of Wayne Rainey, Eddie Lawson, Freddie Spencer, Wayne Gardner, Mick Doohan and Ron Haslam. Including action from memorable races that involved these riders competing against each other.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.desc: Highlights from the second of two Supersport TT races at the prestigious motorcycling event from the Isle of Man. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Cycling: Criterium du Dauphine Highlights: 2017 Stage Four.
programme.desc: Action from stage four of the UCI World Tour race, featuring a 23.5km individual time-trial from La Tour-du-Pin to Bourgoin-Jallieu in France. Presented by Gary Imlach, with commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and reports by Daniel Friebe.(n)

programme.title: Cycling

Light-hearted crime drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: The Car Chasers
programme.desc: US reality series following the exploits of motor dealer Jeff Allen and his team in Lubbock, Texas. Jeff sets his sights on a quick turnover - but Perry and Eric in the workshop shatter his hopes of a big payday.(n)

programme.desc: Henry Cole goes green-laning in Oxfordshire, visits speed week in Yorkshire and tells the story of the Streetfighter, one of the most distinctive styles of modern motorbike.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the 12th day's play at Roland Garros, including the women's semi-finals in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. At this stage 12 months ago, Serena Williams made it to her fourth singles final here with a 7-6, 6-4 victory over Kiki Bertens. In the other match, Garbine Muguruza recorded an impressive 6-2, 6-4 win against Samantha Stosur to set up a repeat of the 2015 Wimbledon final. Today's schedule is also set to include the mixed doubles final and the semi-finals of the men's doubles. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Grand Prix 500: The Rainey Days
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the career of American motorcycling star Wayne Rainey, who was one of the dominant riders in the sport in the 1980s and 1990s. Featuring footage of Rainey battling against the likes of Mick Doohan, Kevin Schwantz and Eddie Lawson, along with contributions from journalists, managers and riders.(n)

programme.title: TT 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the second of the Lightweight TT and TT Zero races at the prestigious motorcycling event from the Isle of Man. Craig Doyle presents, with analysis from Steve Parrish and Steve Plater.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Cycling: Criterium du Dauphine Highlights: 2017 Stage Five.
programme.desc: Action from stage five of the UCI World Tour race, featuring a 175.5km journey from La Tour-de-Salvagny to Macon in France. Presented by Gary Imlach, with commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and reports by Daniel Friebe.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Cycling: Women's Tour Highlights: 2017 Stage Two.
programme.desc: Action from stage two, which took the riders on a 144.5km route starting and finishing in Stoke-on-Trent. Presented by Jill Douglas and Rochelle Gilmore, with commentary by Hugh Porter and Sharon Laws.(n)

programme.sub-title: Bouquet of Barbed Wire to A Touch of Frost.

programme.desc: Things are looking rosy for Carol and Proctor, who have recently become engaged, but Duggan is not so easily swayed from his devious plans and begins to work his charm on Carol, as well as working on a deal that could spell the end of Albery Glass forever. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden.(n)

programme.title: The Chief
programme.desc: Emotions run high when charges of harassment are brought within the Eastland force - and against it. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Julian Glover.(n)

programme.desc: Jack decides to implement a new policy and Richard comes to suspect he and Christine are working as a team in more ways than one. Robert goes on the warpath over the new protocol and threatens to hand in his notice. Meanwhile, Judy's worst fears are confirmed after her father's operation, and the powers that be conspire to cover up a case of steroid abuse by a VIP's son. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is abducted by an old Army friend and former Japanese PoW camp inmate, whose wife's death has left him mentally unbalanced, while Greengrass is well and truly fleeced by father-and-son con-men. Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and John Alderton star.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. With Sarah Miles and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Yvonne is left fighting for her life after being involved in an accident while out mountain-biking with Cathy and Raz. Their arrival at St Victor's puts everyone under pressure to keep their emotions under control. Robert turns a blind eye when Mike carries out a procedure which goes against protocol, and Jack is hurt that Christine won't move in with him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. When she is found murdered, her husband is immediately suspected, but Poirot quickly deduces there is more to the case than a simple crime of passion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect 1973
programme.desc: Bradfield sees a chance to get revenge on Clifford and diverts the team to carry out surveillance on the Bentleys - and when Tennison learns of the operation, she is forced to make a split-second decision as to what is most important, her career or her family? As Bradfield uncovers more details about the heist, he faces the disapproval of his colleagues as he becomes determined to catch them in the act.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of social worker Jenny Lister, but figuring out the motive behind the killing of an apparently popular woman proves difficult. However, an infamous past case involving the death of a child appears to hold the key. In her pursuit of the truth, Vera uncovers the failings of an understaffed care system and discovers the secret at the heart of Jenny's death - which the killer will stop at nothing to protect. Drama based on the book by Ann Cleeves, starring Brenda Blethyn and David Leon.(n)

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Laura is publicly disgraced when news of the Bowers' divorce hits the papers, with grave consequences for the surgery and her friendship with Tom. Pat is tempted by her feelings for Marek while Bob is in hospital. Steph is delighted when Stan returns home on leave, but the reunion is overshadowed by his fears of invasion. Frances discovers a secret at the reading of the will.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney takes Geordie to Johnny Johnson's London jazz club, hoping to leave their worries in Grantchester for the night, but the backstage murder of Johnny's sister Claudette puts paid to that. When Archie, the victim's father and owner of the club, calls in a police officer pal to crack the case, Geordie immediately detects the copper is corrupt, while Sidney makes an important discovery about Claudette that she had kept hidden from all but those closest to her. As every lead seems to come back to Archie's violent past, recriminations within the family begin to play out.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Amanda and Guy's wedding fast approaching, and his betrayal of Hildegard still fresh in his mind, Sidney is thrown deep into crisis, and the murder of a local cop doesn't help matters as he allows himself to become drawn into another case with Geordie. However, tragedy strikes as the duo close in on the killer, and with Geordie's life hanging in the balance, the clergyman finds himself cut out of the investigation as the police close ranks. But that doesn't stop him enlisting the help of Mrs Maguire and Leonard in a daring mission to gather information on the man who shot his partner. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Miller faces a family crisis that may lead to a new suspect, while Carver has an unexpected visitor at the office. David Tennant and Anna Gunn star.(n)

programme.desc: Herbert Armstrong finds himself under great pressure from business rival Oswald Martin and considers the use of arsenic as a way out of his problems once more. Conclusion of the fact-based drama, starring Michael Kitchen, David Thewlis and Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Unaware of Carol's infidelities, Proctor exposes Duggan's conniving and confronts him about his reasons for wanting to sabotage the company - at the risk of revealing his own dark secrets in the process. Drama, starring John Thaw, Sarah Lancashire and Joseph McFadden.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Cardale prepares for Andrew and Erica's wedding, but a health scare at the local old people's home tests everyone to the limit. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.desc: Jack and Christine's relationship begins to cause problems for the team, who are still reeling from the death of Yvonne, while Sam makes a shocking confession and Robert goes on the warpath. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel discovers her ex-partner is the defending barrister for Georgios Stelikos, a man on trial for rape and murder, and she is horrified when the accused escapes conviction. When Stelikos is later found dead, the prime suspect is Hannah Conway, who made public death threats against him after giving evidence for the prosecution in court. Meanwhile, Janet tries to support her colleague following devastating news. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Three weeks after reporting her husband missing, adult-film star Vicky Birkinshaw is arrested on suspicion of his murder. Rachel faces the task of going through the suspect's home-made pornography collection in search of clues, but the case takes a dark twist when Vicky's daughter turns up with her much older boyfriend. Meanwhile, Janet's affair with a colleague is exposed. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Jennifer Francis seizes four emaciated horses and a calf following a heated exchange with their owner.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA responds to a call about two dogs that have been callously abandoned by their owner. Investigator Kirstie Franks goes to the rescue.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.sub-title: The Most Hated Woman in America.
programme.desc: The case of leading atheist Madelaine O'Hare, who went missing with her son and granddaughter in August 1995. Suspicion of involvement fell on an office manager at her publication American Atheists, who eventually admitted guilt, implicated his accomplices and led officers to the trio's buried bodies.(n)

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a man who opened fire at CIA headquarters with an AK-47 assault rifle was brought to book four and a half years later after a $2million reward was offered for his capture.(n)

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The story of college freshman Jason, who found excitement in online dating and started liasing with several girls. However, soon after meeting up with one of them offline, he was killed.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: How the relationship between residents of a Salt Lake City building deteriorated after a neighbour was the assailant in a terrible crime.(n)

programme.title: Six Degrees of Murder
programme.desc: The investigation into 26-year-old Kim Medlin's mysterious disappearance. Secrets were revealed that shattered the safety of everyone in the town of Monroe, North Carolina.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Firefighters discover an unidentified charred body when they are called to the scene of a house fire in the middle of the night.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The case of a man who staged his wife's suicide in a bid to cash in on her life insurance policy, but was caught out by modern forensic technology.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: Murder Detectives: Solved by CCTV: We See You, Kelsey.
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.(n)

programme.title: Six Degrees of Murder
programme.desc: The investigation into 26-year-old Kim Medlin's mysterious disappearance. Secrets were revealed that shattered the safety of everyone in the town of Monroe, North Carolina.(n)

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: How the relationship between residents of a Salt Lake City building deteriorated after a neighbour was the assailant in a terrible crime.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The case of airline co-pilot Andreas Lubitz, who seemingly deliberately crashed a German airliner into the French Alps, killing all 150 passengers on the flight.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: Recalling the carnage at the 2013 Boston Marathon, when an explosion near the finish line resulted in the deaths of three people, while a further 200 were injured. Investigations revealed the cause to be two pressure cooker bombs, placed by brothers Dzhokhar and Tamerlan Tsarnaev.(n)

programme.title: True Crime with Aphrodite Jones
programme.desc: The death of Texas minister Matt Baker's wife Kari in April 2006, who was found with apparent suicide note and empty bottle of sleeping pills. Support was readily offered to her husband Matt Baker when it became known that their baby daughter had also recently died. However, routine investigations soon revealed a mistress and a murder plot and it wasn't long before the finger of suspicion was pointing at Baker.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: After dropping her two boys at school in Coral Springs, Florida, Surya Toha vanishes without a trace. Chilling CCTV footage reveals exactly what happened to her.(n)

programme.title: Murder Calls

As Izzie (Katherine Heigl) cares for the ailing child, Addison (Kate Walsh) decides that it is time to teach the idealistic intern a painful but necessary lesson. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the contemporary Fraoch House in Edinburgh, where Gareth Houston and his mother Heather Davidson hope to impress the guests with their stylish interiors and modern approach to hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: A pair of newlywed B&B owners invite their rivals to a traditional establishment in Marple, Greater Manchester, hoping its quaint location will be enough to secure the prize. However, the guests soon make it abundantly clear that it will take more than an idyllic setting to fulfil their expectations.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Suzy Way, the owner of a modern and unconventional B&B near Loughborough, Leicestershire, and her sister Niki Brown prepare an activity-packed day featuring water sport wakeboarding and a home-made curry to win their guests over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: John Benson is the last to host the group at his B&B in Braintree, Essex, where he hopes his strong business sense and capable manager will make a good impression. A day out at a skidpan track is not to everyone's liking, but dinner is a more relaxed affair, enhanced by spooky stories and a sing-song.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners discover what the other competitors think of their businesses by opening the cash-filled envelopes, which contain what their rivals believe their hosts should receive. They meet for one last time to learn who has won the best value B&B of the week.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps prospective buyers Leslie and Helen Hodgkins from Halifax, West Yorkshire, find a second home in Lanzarote with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A visit to Skipsea in East Yorkshire, where a local woman has found artefacts spanning the Neolithic, Roman and Saxon periods, as well as a wealth of material of Norman origin. Exploring the area, Tony Robinson and team believe they have discovered an entire Norman village not mentioned in records. Travelling to nearby Skipsea Castle, they hope to find clues about this mysterious settlement.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: South Shields, Tyneside: Tower Blocks and Togas.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on a dig in South Shields, Tyne and Wear, a town famous for its ancient Roman fort. Archaeologists have found plenty of evidence to suggest the invaders also built a military cemetery in the area, but its probable location is now the site of a housing estate. Enlisting local aid, the experts begin turning over any open space in the neighbourhood - as well as the odd pavement - in search of evidence.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and expert mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit Portsmouth to come to the aid of former Navy diver whose 1976 Triumph Stag is in desperate need of repair.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud oversees the efforts of Jonathan Belsey, a scientist who is trying to build a carbon-neutral home for his partner and their four daughters. The design and construction are risky because they feature untested technology and an uncompromising choice of materials, and he soon finds the costs spiralling out of control.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Andy Macbeth and Jo Denton, Christchurch earthquake refugees, are building a new life and a modern-day fortress against the elements in alpine Queenstown.(n)

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans meets Milt and Judi Taylor, who want to swap their Oregon apartment for a wooden floating home in the forests surrounding Portland, and young couple Roy and Rianne, who are building a floating residence as their starter home to moor in Amsterdam.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Johnny Vegas taking on guest captain Sarah Millican and Rob Beckett. Susie Dent presides in Dictionary Corner, ably assisted by Vic Reeves, and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Regular team captain Sean Lock is joined by Andrew Flintoff to battle guest captain Bill Bailey and team-mate Roisin Conaty as Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy panel quiz show mash-up. Susie Dent is ably assisted by Rob Beckett in the Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley deals with the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Big Fat Gypsy Weddings
programme.desc: Pat Skye Lee is subject to criticism for choosing to marry someone from outside the Romany community, but his 17-year-old bride Sam Norton is determined to prove her credentials by acquiring a 14st wedding dress that lights up in the dark. Meanwhile, a six-year-old girl receives a spray tan in preparation for her first Communion, which her family is celebrating early before being evicted from a traveller site.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Andy Macbeth and Jo Denton, Christchurch earthquake refugees, are building a new life and a modern-day fortress against the elements in alpine Queenstown.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Gok Wan, Sarah Millican, Seann Walsh and Amy Childs join team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock on the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. The contestants answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Hilton, who runs Robertsbrook Guest House in Swanage, Dorset, feels she has a good chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome have doubts over the cleanliness of their bedroom, and another couple are accustomed to more opulent surroundings.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star B&B Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, the state of their property disappoints their fellow competitors. At dinner, James and Maria Church reveal the truth about their famous daughter Charlotte, and the following morning's breakfast reduces some of the guests to fits of giggles.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the turn of Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria to play host at Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff, and they pull out all the stops by laying on a day of white-water rafting and a magic performance courtesy of their nephew Elliot. But the following morning, some of the guests are kept waiting for breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon, open their doors for the final stay of the competition. The Churches find their four-poster bed too small, and not all the guests enjoy their trip to a local glass-blowing factory, but feedback at check-out time leaves the hosts feeling confident.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. An underpayment from a surprising source changes the dynamics of the group and throws the competition wide open, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cape Coral in Florida, where he tries to help Tim Morris and his partner Elaine find their dream waterfront property on a budget of £300,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple disagree over where to spend their retirement, with husband Michael hoping to set up home in Derbyshire, where he will be able to indulge his passion for the British countryside. Conversely, his wife Susan would like to spend her time relaxing by a pool in the Spanish sun, and it is left up to Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman to help them decide where to spend their £180,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Northamptonshire, where they expect to find the remains of a Norman hunting lodge. However, the results prove confusing - the buildings they uncover are clearly too small for the lodge, but since the forests were protected, it remains a mystery what other structure would have been built there. Scouring the Domesday Book for clues, they also learn a large number of pigs were kept on the site, suggesting this could have been one of the world's first factory farms.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Brunel's Last Launch: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Archaeologists scour the banks of the Thames to examine the site of the disastrous launching of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's SS Great Eastern in 1858. Tony Robinson joins them as the team inspects the slipways to ascertain the reason for the disaster and how it affected shipbuilding in London.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Suffolk to secretly restore a charismatic but worn-out 1928 Austin 12 Tourer. Despite its many problems, the duo are confident that they can repair the grand old dame of the road.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2010, Claire Farrow and Ian Hogarth built a home containing a sauna, spa, dance floor and DJ booth on a small patch of land in Kensington, central London. It was a notorious project with several setbacks - including their digger smashing into a neighbour's wall and the re-emergence of the old river under the building. These threatened to prevent them completing the project, but two years later Kevin McCloud revisits the duo to see how things have progressed.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This edition explores the challenges that inevitably come with the end of life, and how the emergency services have to learn to cope when dealing with death on a daily basis. In Warrington, paramedics arrive at the home of a man having a suspected cardiac arrest, and with CPR already being carried out and a defibrillator at close hand, the man is given the best possible chance of survival. Plus, ambulance staff and police officers discuss being called to sudden deaths.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man with schizophrenia is admitted for the 19th time in a year after failing to take his diabetes medication. Meanwhile, a former betting-shop manager and a 16-year-old both suffer suspected strokes - the 61-year-old, once known as the `memory man', is now coming to terms with his diminishing mental capabilities, while the teenager's identical twin and mother wait by his bedside for the results of a brain scan.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The latest batch of patients to be treated in the A&E department of London's King's College Hospital includes two with serious head injuries, one of whom, a Brighton female cyclist, has been airlifted to the building. Also brought in by helicopter is a father-of-four who fell from scaffolding as he repaired a roof, while other cases include former docker Bill, who has hurt his knee while drinking at his local working men's club.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Green Berets
programme.desc: The troops at the heart of the harrowing special National Geographic: Inside the Green Berets are far from standard issue military men. As the U.S. soldiers assigned to a outpost in southern Afghanistan christened Firebase Cobra, and required to protect Afghani domestics from the brutal minions of the Taliban, these Berets walk a hair-thin line of risk between life and death, between sanctity and martyrdom. Following 9/11, the U.S. Pentagon restricted this region to the general press for reasons of security and safety, but made a brief, 48-hour exception for members of the National Geographic crew. During that precious span of time, the Taliban indeed struck; two American berets were killed, five others wounded, and members of the camera crew were severely injured as well. Inside the Green Berets presents the footage shot during that two day span, and thus creates an intense and uncompromising glimpse at the lives of the soldiers - the day-to-day risks they traverse, and the heroism they wield - in the said region(n)

programme.title: America the Wild
programme.desc: Stalking the Mountain Lion. Naturalist Casey Anderson sets out to fulfill his lifelong dream of tracking one of North America's most elusive ghosts: the Mountain Lion. Casey's longtime friend and cat expert, Tyler Johnerson, is on hand to help him in his quest to witness the ghost of the Rockies. Casey and Tyler set out together armed with specialized camera technology hoping to document never before seen footage of Mountain Lions living in the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. Aided by Tyler's keen hound dogs, the same strategy employed by leading cat researchers, Tyler and Casey get hot on the heels of this formidable and cunning predator - an animal capable of jumping vertically nearly twenty feet in a single leap and taking prey much larger than its distant relation, the bobcat(n)

programme.desc: She slices through the waters surface with explosive power. Sail, spear, and a half ton of muscle flash in the sun. Then just as suddenly she vanishes to resume her endless race through the open ocean. Her journeys are epic. Her life cycle, bizarre. She is a billfish, largest, fastest, and most highly prized of all gamefish. Rarely caught on film, her astonishing story has never been fully told. Now, Wild Logic travels the oceans of the world to reveal the secrets of the billfish(n)

programme.title: Kingdom of the Blue Whale
programme.desc: Supported by the National Geographic Society, the world's eminent blue whale scientists embark on a revolutionary mission: they'll find, identify and tag California blue whales, use the DNA samples to confirm the sex of individual whales - then rejoin the massive creatures' stunning migration when they collect at a chimera known as the Costa Rica Dome. These experts have observed, firsthand, courtship behaviour among the whales at the moving mass of krill and currents 500 miles off the coast of Costa Rica. Now they hope to find - and record - the Holy Grail of blue whale science ? the breeding and calving grounds of the biggest mammals in the sea(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: Winged Migration co-directors Jacques Cluzaud and Jacques Perrin re-team for this documentary produced for Walt Disney Studios' Disneynature banner and exploring the many mysteries of our planet's oceans. Almost three-quarters of the earth's surface is covered by oceans, yet strangely we seem to know more about deep space than the world of the sea. There's no question that the ocean has played a crucial role in the history and sustenance of humankind, but what secrets does the underwater world hold? Follow filmmakers Cluzaud and Perrin beneath the ocean waves as they seek out the answer to this and explore the many dangers and mysteries of the deep(n)

programme.title: The Loud House

Elsewhere, Joey (Matt LeBlanc) hadn't intended for his recent one-night stand to be chosen as the girl for him by Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) and Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow); and Monica (Courteney Cox) and Chandler (Matthew Perry) are put on the spot when the troublesome Janice (Maggie Wheeler) is accidentally invited to their upcoming wedding(n)

Her protective dad is determined to stand by her through thick and thin, but over the next nine months, small-town gossip starts to take its toll on him. Stephen Frears' comedy drama, based on Roddy Doyle's novel, starring Tina Kellegher and Colm Meaney.(n)

programme.title: The Waiting Game
programme.desc: The reality of life on the road for Stephen Brennan, Alan Stanford, Barry McGovern and Johnny Murphy, a troupe of veteran actors who have played the same parts in Samuel Beckett's Waiting for Godot for the past 20 years. The film follows the actors in 2008 for their 20th anniversary tour with Waiting for Godot, which played to packed houses around Ireland, and serves as a tribute to Murphy, who died in February of this year.(n)

programme.title: Then Comes Marriage
programme.desc: Kenneth Kerrigan and Linda Richie, Melissa Devlin and Steve Spratt, and Natalie Roberston and Shane Kiernan road-test their relationship at the retreat in Rathvilly.(n)

programme.title: Vogue's Wild Girls
programme.desc: Documentary in which Vogue Williams meets some of the world's toughest women, starting at the Miami-Dade Prison Bootcamp in Florida. She also travels to the Lowell Female Correctional Institute in Central Florida. There she meets convicted murderer Emilia Carr who, at 30, is the youngest female prisoner on death row in America.(n)

programme.title: Stetsons and Stilettos
programme.desc: The series follows a busy summer for the owner of one of Ireland's most famous country music shop in Co Tyrone, which is also home to a record label. The business has been the centre of Ireland's country music scene since 1975, and now preparations are under way for an important celebration.(n)

programme.title: Making It Down Under
programme.desc: Cameras follow recent Irish arrivals in Australia as they work in challenging careers. In the first edition, doctor Matthew Mulkeen flies to the scene of life-threatening accident, and Con O'Sullivan drives the biggest cattle train in the world.(n)

programme.title: The Taste of Success
programme.desc: It is the semi-final, and the remaining contestants face an unexpected surprise - a 40 strong focus group who will judge their product.(n)

programme.title: You Should Really See a Doctor
programme.desc: Dr Pixie McKenna and Dr Phil Kieran bring their pop-up clinic to Kilkenny, where they come to the aid of people suffering constant pain. Their patients include a man with chronic constipation who is unable to sleep for more than an hour and a half each night, and a woman with a undiagnosed skin condition that even Pixie cannot recognise.(n)

programme.title: Operation Transformation
programme.desc: With less than a week to go until the leaders tackle the annual 5k run in the Phoenix Park, the pressure is on. Plus, all five schools and their celebrity mentors record the official It's Your Move dance fitness video.(n)

programme.title: Operation Transformation
programme.desc: With just days to go until the leaders tackle the annual 5k in the Phoenix Park, the remaining leaders face their penultimate weigh-in. Have they finally hit their stride as they hurtle toward their last time on the scales next week?.(n)

programme.title: Domestic Divas
programme.desc: Aisli and Cat meet single mother Liz, who desperately wants to throw a memorable first birthday party for her son Luke. She does not know where to start and needs ideas for party invites and games, as well as making the all-important cake. With members of her family flying in from America to meet the birthday boy for the first time, she wants them to be impressed by the celebrations.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: It's New Year's Eve in the ED, and as the team looks forward to 2015, Lofty is making a video of their resolutions - although not all of them are quite so keen on the idea, while Tess is worried by a potential staffing crisis on the busiest night of the year. Mining geologist Elaine Hayde finds herself on a wrong end of a scare while checking gas levels at a gold mine 600km north of Perth. Former Cashel resident Josie Finnegan receives a visit from a lifelong friend from back home, and trainee jockey Louise Day goes for a pre-dawn ride at Caulfield Stables, before meeting a friend in downtown Melbourne to discuss the trials of working in a male-dominated industry.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Two semi-finalists work a shift in Pierre Koffmann's restaurant at the Berkeley hotel in Knightsbridge, central London, before the chef asks them to prepare one of his signature dishes - a confit of salmon with sauteed Bayonne ham and a piperade of tomatoes and green peppers. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti, who pick one of them to go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: New series. Action drama based on the film franchise. Grief-stricken after the loss of his wife and unborn child, ex-Navy Seal-turned-detective Martin Riggs moves to California to start afresh at the LAPD. He's paired up with veteran detective Roger Murtaugh, who's just coming back to the job after a near-fatal heart attack. Riggs' penchant for diving headfirst into the line of fire soon clashes with Murtaugh's prudent by-the-book technique and his life-on-the-edge attitude makes him a priority case for the department's psychologist. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Riggs and Murtaugh respond to a noise complaint at a party at a heavyweight boxer Hollywood hills home. When gunshots go off, they are drawn into a more important case involving illegal gun-runners with advanced military technology. Riggs becomes personally invested in matters when he discovers one of their targets is a pregnant woman who reminds him of his late wife. Meanwhile, Trish worries about Murtaugh's health, as his partnership with Riggs tests his limits. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star.(n)

programme.title: My Mad Fat Diary
programme.desc: Part two of two. A crisis with Chloe leaves Rae in a dark and lonely place without the support of her friends and family, and having now alienated everyone, it is up to Rae to sort out her own problems. Comedy, starring Sharon Rooney. Last in the series.(n)

Rick also resumes his search for the perfect cod.(n)

programme.desc: Dubliners Tracey and Peter have been together six years after meeting online. Tracey is the organiser, Peter is the complete opposite, a laidback scatterbrain whose only loves in life - apart from his bride-to-be - are their two-year-old son and football. Now he gets the chance to prove his worth, but it proves a rocky road to the big day, with advice from a naked stranger and a dodgy wedding veil before they get to the reception at - where else? - the sports club.(n)

programme.title: My Granny the Escort
programme.desc: Their clients are men of all ages, some as young as 20. Award-winning film-maker Charlie Russell offers a frank, intimate and revealing portrait of three of Britain's mature escorts - older women who choose to sell sex from hotel rooms and their homes. As well as topping up their pensions, these women seem to be enjoying themselves in their chosen profession, but the documentary also questions how such a lifestyle can co-exist with their family lives and roles as mothers and grandparents.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
